title: Mid & Entry Mechanical HVAC/Refrigeration (Willing Train)
description:
ON TIME HVAC SF philosophy to provide excellent technical service for commercial HVACR. Utilizing the latest diagnostic tools, equipment, parts, materials with superior expertise to servicing commercial HVAC/Refrigeration. ON TIME pride ourselves in outstanding customer services to restaurants and businesses for San Francisco greater bay area.

** IMPORTANT - email RESUME for consideration of employment ** We will not respond without your work experience information.

Mid Level Technician & Entry Mechanical Assistant (Commercial HVAC/Refrigeration) position 

“Working is not a JOB, when you love what you do!” 

Enjoy working on-site in a technical field with a commitment to being a team player. We are seeking a highly motivated individual looking to establish their career in HVAC/Refrigeration field with growth opportunities and seeking long term employment. (Ideal candidate 3-5 years plus working at company) 

Candidate’s that change jobs/company every 1-2 years would not be a good match.

Mid level technician qualifications 1-3 years of field experience. Holds EPA certificate and some formal educational training in HVAC/Refrigeration from a credited school or work experience. Expand your knowledge with real world trouble-shooting, servicing and repairing HVAC, commercial walk-in coolers, reach-in refrigeration and restaurant kitchen exhaust ventilators/blowers. 

Entry - Intern mechanical assistant enjoys working with their hands, utilizing tools, trouble-shoot, tinkering, repairing things with aptitude to disassemble and reassemble of equipment/automobile/appliance/miscellaneous. Willing to train for a motivated individual to work flexible schedules in tradesman profession. Recent graduate and current students in HVAC/Refrigeration field is a plus to utilize your formal training while learning real world trouble-shooting of commercial equipment. 

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 
Individual desire to utilize mechanical and trouble-shooting knowledge in HVAC/Refrigeration
Communicate effectively with owner, customers and suppliers
Repairing commercial exhaust ventilators, industrial refrigeration and HVAC
Assist in bringing tools, parts and materials onsite to diagnosis commercial equipment
Climbing ladders and working safely on roofs (Mandatory)
Utilizing hand/power tools with organized approach
Take apart and reassemble commercial kitchen exhaust ventilator/motors
Troubleshoot and repair commercial walk in, reach in refrigeration/freezers
Driving work van to customer in SF bay area (No DUI - clean record)
Lift and hoist equipment to roof (50+ lbs) multiple times

QUALIFICATIONS:
-------------------------
Long Term Employment
English verbal & writing
Clean driving record
Safety consciousness 
Attention to details
Physically fit 
Self motivated/Hard worker
Desire to learn and grow
Strong work ethics
Organized 
Good communication skills
Flexible work schedule
Working heights on roofs
Honesty with integrity (Mandatory)

ONTIMEHVACSF.COM

title: Route Driver
description:
We are always looking for good people. We now have an opening for a route driver.  It’s the perfect job for someone who enjoys working independently.  We have four delivery routes, covering the Greater Bay Area, Monterey Bay area and the North Bay.  

You must be able to lift 75 pounds, enjoy interaction with customers, read a tape measure, and be reliable. Prior delivery or glass experience is helpful but not necessary - we will train.  Three years’ clean DMV record is necessary.  In addition, you will be the main point of contact with our customers and should enjoy dealing with people.

Original Glass Designs is a family-owned business that bevels mirrors; makes glass shelves and tabletops. Our trucks deliver in a 100-mile radius around San Jose. We have been in business since 1988 and employ 18 hardworking people. 

We offer paid holidays, vacation and sick leave, a medical plan, a retirement plan, etc.

Three ways to apply
1. Email to this ad
2. Phone 408-467-9900
3. In person

1740 Junction Avenue
Unit D (back left corner of building)
San Jose

title: Electrician Journeyman and Apprentice Santa Clara
description:
We are looking for licensed Journeyman Electricians and Apprentice electricians in the Bay Area.
Opportunity for long term employment with a growing Bay area electrical contractor to fill several positions that and will start ASAP!

All candidates are encouraged to apply!

What we are looking for:
Journeyman Electricians with min 5 years experience and Apprentice Electricians with Min 2 years experience! or more with a current state of CA license
Familiar with the most updated NEC codes
Experience working in a commercial setting
Experience reading and interpreting blue prints

Qualified candidates should have significant exposure to the following:
Must be able to work safely following Cal/OSHA regulations and company safety program
Installing and terminating electrical panels and transformers, feeding AC units, install fixtures, outlets and various electrical lighting control devices
Experience Cutting, bending, running electrical conduit materials
Pulling electrical wiring through electrical conduit and marking circuit numbers on plans and on J box covers
Installing and connecting wires to circuit breakers, outlets or other components and systems.

We Offer:

401K, Vacation, Medical, dental, vision benefits.
PTO. Please send us an updated resume.

title: WISE SONS FOH Team Member ($16.50/hr + avg $6/hr tips)
description:
JOIN WISE SONS:
Founded in San Francisco's Mission District, Wise Sons is California-inspired Jewish deli food with roots in tradition and an eye on the future, for Jews who like food and food lovers who like Jews. With six locations (for now...) and a presence at multiple farmer's markets, we are a rapidly growing, nationally-recognized brand. We work hard to keep evolving, commit to quality, prioritize people and most importantly, be a mensch in every sense of the word.

IN A NUTSHELL:
We are seeking both full-time and part-time cashiers. All shifts end by 3pm. Some early mornings + weekend availability is REQUIRED.

Wise Sons team members have the flexibility to run the cash register, fulfill catering orders, expo and bus all in a day's work. As a hybrid team member, you are responsible for serving all guests as well as maintaining a clean and safe work environment. Teamwork is crucial to our organization and front of house team members are expected to jump in wherever necessary to get the job done. This may mean packing cream cheese, mopping up a spill, or carrying a catering order out to a guest's vehicle.

Our ideal candidate is passionate about food and believes in giving guests the best experience possible.

THE QUALITIES and REQUIREMENTS to succeed:
- Enjoy working as part of a team; a roll-up-your-sleeves mentality in a diverse and fast paced environment
- The desire to create a warm, welcoming experience for customers and your fellow coworkers
- Strong organizational and time management skills
- Weekend availability is required
- Cash handling experience preferred
- Fluency with POS systems preferred
- Food Handler’s Certificate, or ability to obtain on
- Be able to reach, bend, stoop and frequently lift up to 50 pounds

PERKS WE OFFER YOU:
- 100% paid Employee Medical Care (for full-time)
- Access to Dental, Vision, Commuter Benefits, 401k
- Free Bagels and Pastrami!
- Shift Meal; Employee Discounts at all Wise Sons locations
- Opportunity to develop into management and leadership roles

Jewish cuisine represents the culmination of one peoples’ journey across different countries, cultures and time periods. Wise Sons honors that tradition through a dedication to hiring a diverse workforce to help usher in the latest chapter of that story here in California.

Wise Sons is an equal opportunity employer. Our zero-tolerance policy means that no form of unlawful discriminatory or harassing conduct towards any employee, client, customer, or vendor in our workplace will be tolerated.

title: Registered Nurse, Post Anesthesia Care Unit
description:
The Surgery Center, Joint Commission accredited, is looking for dedicated, experienced, quality-driven Post Anesthesia Care Unit Registered Nurses to join our professional patient care team.

The Surgery Center has served the Bay Area community for over 25 years and is known for the highest of standards in the specialty of ambulatory surgery.  A dedicated anesthesia team, an on-site Medical Director, a group of superior surgeons, a proactive and talented staff and an open-door management philosophy are only a few of the assets that influence other professionals, like yourself, to join our team.  Additionally, we offer competitive wages and an enhanced benefits package.  

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
Licenses or Certifications:  
Current California RN license.  AHA – CPR, ACLS, and PALS Certification. 
CPAN certification preferred.

Education, Vocational Training and Experience:  (minimum requirement of candidate) Graduate of an Accredited School of Nursing.  At least 2 years Critical Care experience preferred, and one year in perioperative nursing preferred, with preference to ambulatory surgery services.

We are located in a metropolitan area on the boundaries of Berkeley and Oakland.  We are adjacent to the Bay Area Rapid Transit (BART) station for easy access via public transportation and we also offer free reserved parking.

We are looking for California licensed Registered Nurses (Part Time - 3 - 10 hrs shifts, benefitted) in the Post Anesthesia Care Unit (PACU).  RN applying MUST have PACU, ER, or critical care experience.  No new graduate program available.

The Surgery Center is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  The Surgery Center will recruit, hire, train, and promote persons without regard to race, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ethnicity, marital status, familial status, political belief, sexual orientation, disability, medical condition or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.

If you are motivated to work in a fast-paced, high quality environment with a mix of specialty services, please contact us by faxing your resume to Lisa Shebell, RN, Interim Administrator, Fax: 510-653-5242.

title: Case Manager (Income CCACS, Concord)
description:
Description

The Contra Costa Adult Continuum of Services (CCACS) is a program of Contra Costa Health Services Health, Housing and Homeless Services Division, in partnership with Heluna Health. Our mission is to provide safe, interim housing with comprehensive services that assist homeless adults in securing permanent housing that will end their homelessness. We respect human dignity and believe housing is a right that is supported through advocacy and collaboration (www.cchealth.org/services.homeless).

If hired for this position, applicant will be required to provide proof of full vaccination (including booster, if eligible) for COVID-19 prior to the start date.

Hourly rate range: $24.00 - $27.00

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Establish and maintain a caseload and conduct Needs Assessment interviews (related to psychosocial, mental, and physical health, housing, income, AOD services, legal, etc.); as well as VI-SPDAT.
Meet with clients weekly to assist in developing and monitoring a case/life/treatment plan
Assist client in obtaining appropriate identification, as well as benefits such as Medi-Cal, SSI, GA, Cal Fresh and other benefits, and services immediately upon program entry.
Identify, support, and closely coordinate client’s access to resources and services related to Needs Assessment outcomes. Referrals to: Housing Specialists, Income Specialists, Mental Health Case Managers/Clinicians, Healthcare for the Homeless Community Health Workers and Nurse Practitioners, Alcohol and Other Drug Access Line/AOD Counselors, legal services, other referral sources as needed.
Support client to access community resources by transporting, accompanying, and coaching client when navigating community resources. Agency vehicle provided.
Maintain client files and associated case management documentation that include case notes, documentation, and electronic records on the Homeless Management Information System (HMIS).
Completes HMIS standardized forms. Submit completed forms to the appropriate staff member within 24-hours of service.
Educate clients on daily living skills to improve self-sufficiency, build authentic rapport to support clients’ goals on an ongoing basis.
Facilitate relationship-building with clients and their family members, including family reunification meeting and conflict resolution as needed
Regularly report and coordinate client progress during multi-disciplinary team case conference.
Attend all required meetings, trainings, and case conferences.
Submit reports to the Program Manager as required.
Other duties as assigned.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS

Possesses effective communication skills and the ability to work independently and cooperatively.
Thorough knowledge of homelessness, mental health, substance abuse, HIV and cultural diversity issues.
Have a good knowledge of community and support service resources for special needs populations.
Have a strong knowledge of Motivational Interviewing, Trauma Informed Care, and Harm Reduction models.
Excellent communication skills, professional demeanor, sound judgment, and strong organizational skills
Ability to work in fast-paced and high-stress environments
A successful applicant will be fingerprinted and must pass the criteria used by the State of California to screen for criminal convictions that would be deemed detrimental to working with youth.
Ability to work with diverse populations.
Ability to communicate clearly, both in verbal and written forms.
Good computer skills (Word, Excel, HMIS systems, data entry, Outlook) required.
Ability to be supportive and provide guidance in a non-judgmental manner

Education/Experience

Education: AA/AS Degree from an accredited college or university in Public Health, Health Services Administration, Social Work, or a closely related field.
Preferred BA/BS in Public Health, Health Services Administration, Social Work, or a closely related field.
Experience: One (1) year of full-time housing case management, or its equivalent, experience in a social services or mental health program providing services to homeless persons. OR
Substitution for Education/Experience: Three (3) years of full time, or its equivalent, experience working in a program serving homeless persons AND HS Diploma/GED.

DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS

Applicants who are bilingual in Spanish or Southeast Asian languages are encouraged to apply. 
Experience working in Contra Costa County and knowledge of social service providers in the area

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Stand                                       Frequently

Walk                                        Occasionally

Sit                                            Frequently

Handling / Fingering               Frequently

Reach Outward                       Occasionally

Reach Above Shoulder           Occasionally

Climb, Crawl, Kneel, Bend     Occasionally

Lift / Carry                               Occasionally - Up to 50 lbs

Push/Pull                                 Occasionally - Up to 50 lbs

See                                          Constantly

Taste/ Smell                            Not Applicable

Not Applicable          Not required for essential functions

Occasionally             (0 - 2 hrs/day)

Frequently                 (2 - 5 hrs/day)

Constantly                 (5+ hrs/day)

WORK ENVIRONMENT

Various environments depending on job necessities can include, but not limited to; General Office Setting, Homeless Shelter, Field work within Contra Costa County

Heluna Health is an Affirmative Action, Equal Opportunity Employer that encourages minorities, women, veterans, and disabled to apply.

Qualifications
Education
Required
Associates or better in Public Health or related field.

Preferred
Bachelors or better in Public Health or related field.

Experience
Required
1 year: full-time housing case management, or its equivalent, experience in a social services or mental health program providing services to homeless persons.

Please include your resume and cover letter with the application.
Apply here: https://recruiting2.ultipro.com/PUB1001PUBH/JobBoard/6705aa07-0bcb-4660-ad1b-2fda952becc7/OpportunityDetail?opportunityId=b65d1f8d-7c66-4535-85b2-a23fb5c49db2

title: Part Time Customer Sales Rep - Work from Home
description:
We are looking to fill part time work positions right away.  Interview now and start within the week!


Work we have available:
Are you looking for work? Our company is looking to fill positions right away. We have part time positions in entry level customer sales and service. So what you would be doing if everything were to work out, is working with customers, answering any of their questions, explaining products to them, and helping them place orders. There is no experience needed to start working and no cost to start. Must be comfortable working with people. 

Pay and schedules:
The pay starts at $28.00 base-appt, weekly pay. Let me be clear on this point: that is a flat rate, not based on sales or commissions. There is an opportunity to earn more based on performance. Some conditions exist. Most people start with ZERO experience, so they like the fact that the pay is not based on sales or results. New team members always say our simple, fun training gives them all the confidence they need.  We look for people that want to improve their resume and communication skills, not just those who want to make money (we DO offer pay-raises for top performers).  We work with a lot of students & people who have other jobs, so our schedules are flexible. We have weekends, days, or evenings available. 
 
How to schedule an interview:
All ages eighteen and up are invited to interview with us (or seventeen and a high school graduate). Must be willing to work with people. We encourage applicants of all ages and experience, as we do not discriminate on the basis of an applicant’s age.

All you have to do is click here to apply online today. A staff member will reach out to you via text to set you up with an interview with our company. 
 
You do NOT need any experience to interview. However, we are filling openings *immediately* so don’t delay.

If you're eager to learn and looking for resume experience, we might be a good fit for each other. 

Good luck!

title: Courtroom Clerk I
description:
Are you looking for a new challenge? Do you have exceptional customer service skills? Are you goal and detail oriented, organized, and adaptable? If so, we may have the perfect opportunity for you!

The Superior Court of California, County of Alameda is accepting applications for the position of Courtroom Clerk I. Under general supervision, the Courtroom Clerk I records and prepares minutes of all types of court proceedings; resolves workflow and other technical and procedural problems within the courtroom; enters and retrieves information from automated and manual record keeping systems; and performs other related duties as assigned.

A new eligibility list will be established to fill Courtroom Clerk I vacancies at various court locations. Courtroom Clerks may be assigned or reassigned to various locations within the County and work between the hours of 8:00 a.m. to 5:30 p.m., as determined by the business needs of the Court.


APPLY TODAY:

To learn more & apply by February 21, 2024, visit our career site: https://alamedacourts.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/alamedacourts/details/Courtroom-Clerk-I_R895


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Education:
Possession of an Associate of Arts or Associate of Science degree or equivalent to two years of college coursework with 60 semester units or 90 quarter units from an accredited college or university.

And

Experience:
The equivalent to two years of full-time increasingly responsible clerical experience in a banking, court, education, health care, law enforcement, legal, probation or social services environment.

Additional qualifying work experience as described above may substitute for the required education on a year-for-year basis. One year (2080 hours) of additional qualifying work experience will be considered equivalent to 30 semester units/45 quarter units.

If you require accommodation in the examination process because of disability, please call (510) 891-6021 to discuss.

title: Taste of the World Market - Event Coordinator (Food Trucks)
description:
JOB SUMMARY
Heard about that awesome Food Truck Market that’s in and around the East Bay Area? That’s us! Taste of the World (TOW) Market is looking for part-time Event Coordinator to join our small, but mighty team. You will be a face for TOW Market, meaning we expect you to engage with customers, manage and grow vendor relationships, ensure a safe and clean environment, and most importantly make our events FUN for all!

As a member of TOW, you would work the hours and days of our weekly markets. This role is a contract based position and dependent on varying seasonality. A typical schedule requires evening and weekend work with varying hours dependent on events (around 20-25 hours/week) You’ll need to possess a current CA drivers license and have a safe driving record.

This is a great starting position, and we are looking for someone to grow within Taste of the World Market. If you're responsible, attentive, resourceful, proactive, into the emerging Bay Area foodie scene, and are (able to lift 50 pounds consistently) then we want you!

RESPONSIBILITIES
•	Market Setup and Teardown - unload/loading, setting up/ taking down tables/chairs, displays, garbage/recycling, electrical supply.
•	Food Truck Vendor Relations - provide support as needed, ensure they are one of the family while helping to provide the best service to our customers. Collecting vendor event payment and managing vendor rules/regulations to ensure they’re adhered to. 
•	Represent TOW - greet, welcome and thank guests, provide information as needed, go the extra mile for guests; represent our brand with pride, role modeling our values, standards and foodie-passion, answer any questions they may have
•	Safety Monitoring - remove any obstacles and potential dangers, help keep areas clean and debris free.
•	Complete the setup and/or breakdown of generators, tables/chairs, tents, displays, and music equipment. Care for and ensure proper treatment of all materials and TOW Market property
•	Follow and execute a specific event layout within a strict event timeline
•	Maintain inventory and condition of materials, tools, hardware, and storage equipment.
•	Adhere to safety procedures, removing any obstacles and potential dangers from the site
•	Uphold TOW Market standards at all times and follow all implemented policies and procedures

JOB REQUIREMENTS
•	Must have a reliable source of transportation to and from home, office, and events.
•	You’ll need to possess a current CA driver’s license and have a safe driving record as you’ll be required to operate our sprinter van to and from events.  
•	Enthusiasm for people and food trucks
•	Must enjoy working outside, in varying weather conditions, and in a team environment.
•	Available to work evenings and weekends on a regular basis.
•	Possess a supportive and can-do attitude.
•	Trustworthy, ethical business practices, ability to handle money efficiently. 

PHYSICAL DEMANDS
•	Required to bend, lift or climb, and stand on your feet throughout work period
•	Required to lift light to heavy weights (up to 50lbs)
•	While performing the job duties, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear; sit; stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls, reach with hands and arms. Specific vision abilities required include visual acuity to determine the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of the work assigned, close visual acuity to perform an activity. In addition, the employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.

HOW TO APPLY
Please send an email to the address above and your resume and a brief description as to why you're a good fit for our team and interested in the position. Candidates responding to this posting must currently possess the eligibility to work in the United States.

title: Apprentice Carpenter
description:
looking to fill a long-term/Full-Time position for a mid-level apprentice carpenter with 2yrs experience. The ideal candidate should have knowledge and be able to safety use all power tools. Be comfortable working with a team as well as independently, is proactive with a problem-solving mindset and enjoys doing a little bit of everything in the carpentry field. 

Summary: 
Working directly with the construction supervisor. The Apprentice Carpenter will essentially assist in carpentry jobs and put into practice their fundamental knowledge of residential, commercial, and industrial carpentry.

Essential Obligations and Responsibilities:
You will demonstrate skills in the safe operation of hand power tools, including (but not limited to) jigsaws, circular saws, drills, ladders, table saws, routers, and sanding equipment.
•	Assembly and disassembly of scaffolding.
•	Help with demolition and debris removal.
•	Basic to intermediate experience in the application of timber and steel beam framing
•	Basic to intermediate experience in woodworking finishing skills, including cutting, and installing wood framing, trim, baseboards, framing, doors, and siding.
•	Assists with the construction, assembly, and securing of temporary and permanent partitions using a variety of building materials.
•	Build and secure temporary and permanent partitions.
•	You will always practice good cleaning to ensure a safe and orderly workplace.
•	Work with time constraints to meet specific deadlines.
•	Ensure attention to detail and a keen sense of safeguarding other people's property and information.
•	Participates in and demonstrates understanding of safety principles and practices; Follows all safety policies and procedures to support a safe work environment, including the safe operation of machines, tools, and equipment.
•	Comply with all Company policies and procedures.
•	Proactively communicate workplace conditions and concerns that may or are affecting job completion to the supervisor.

Requirements:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each of the essential functions satisfactorily. The requirements in the list below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or skills required.
•	1 to 2 years of experience in Construction.
•	Strong verbal and written communication skills.
•	Basic computer and/or tablet/iPad experience.
•	Ability to work in a team or independently as needed.
•	Valid driver license and clean DMV record.
•	Bilingual a plus but not required.
•	Multitask in a fast-paced environment.
•	Strong organizational, problem solving, and analytical skills.
•	Ability to manage various priorities, projects, and workflow.
•	Must be able to communicate effectively with all levels of management and personnel. 
•	Must possess the ability to work a flexible full-time schedule. 

Physical Demands:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that an employee must meet in order to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, sit, use hands to touch, touch or feel, reach with hands and arms, climb or balance and bend, kneel, bend or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.

Work Environment:
The characteristics of the work environment described herein are representative of those encountered by an employee while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts, high and precarious places, fumes or particles in the air, toxic or caustic chemicals, and external weather conditions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

Benefits: 
•	Health, Vision and Dental
•	Life Insurance
•	401K
•	Paid Time Off

The above reflects management’s definition of essential functions for this job but does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned.  Management may assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons.

title: Now Hiring Bartenders and Servers
description:
Upscale Mexican Restaurant Now Hiring: Bartenders and Servers

Join our team at Casa Azteca, a  Mexican restaurant located in Milpitas. We are currently seeking experienced and passionate Bartenders and Servers to provide exceptional service and create unforgettable dining experiences for our esteemed guests.

**Position: Bartender**
As a Bartender at Casa Azteca, you will be responsible for crafting innovative and artisanal cocktails, maintaining an immaculate bar area, and delivering prompt and friendly service to our patrons. Your creativity, knowledge of mixology, and attention to detail will contribute to the vibrant and sophisticated atmosphere of our establishment.

Requirements:
- Proven experience as a Bartender in a restaurant or bar setting.
- Extensive knowledge of mixology, including classic and modern cocktail recipes.
- Ability to multitask and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
- Exceptional attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality service.
- Must be at least 21 years of age and possess a valid bartending certification.

**Position: Server**
As a Server at Casa Azteca you will play a vital role in providing attentive and personalized service to our guests. With your warm personality and passion for hospitality, you will guide diners through our menu, make recommendations, and ensure a seamless dining experience from start to finish.

**Requirements:**
- Previous experience as a Server in an upscale restaurant or fine dining establishment.
- Excellent knowledge of food and beverage menus, including Mexican cuisine and traditional pairings.
- Strong customer service skills and the ability to create personalized experiences for guests.
- Exceptional communication and teamwork abilities.
- Ability to work well under pressure and handle challenging situations with grace.
- Must be at least 18 years of age.

**How to Apply:**
If you are passionate about delivering exceptional service, have a genuine love for Mexican cuisine and culture, and thrive in a dynamic and upscale environment, we would love to hear from you. 

Please email a copy if your resume or
Submit a physical copy at 20 N Abel Street, Milpitas, CA, 95035.
Only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview.

Join us at Casa Azteca and be part of a dedicated team that embraces excellence and delights in creating unforgettable dining experiences. We look forward to welcoming you aboard!

The space is really relaxed, professional and up scale.  We want folks that know how to act and look professional.  We are a well rated establishment looking for professionals who are also.

Email us to find out more and we can schedule some time to talk!

Thanks so much for reading :) look forward to connecting with you!

title: Remote Life Insurance Sales
description:
.

Seeking high-character, ambitious life insurance agents for remote sales work.
Opportunity to build your own agency if desired.

No experience necessary.

We are a licensed brokerage selling life insurance and annuities from major national insurance carriers to people who have already expressed interest in these products and requested help.

High income potential, LOTS of training and support, flexible schedule, leads available, NO cold calling!


(Please read the entire post. Interview instructions below.)



Do you...Need to support your family and generate income for the things you want to do in life?
Are you ready for freedom and time flexibility?
Are you tired of working to build someone else's empire and support THEIR lifestyle and future rather than YOUR OWN?
Do you want to work with a tight-knit team where you're part of the family, not just a cog in a machine?
(If you answered YES to any of those questions, keep reading...)



Why Financial Services? Why The Leake Agency?

How about TODAY being the day you take back your life and secure your future? Start a career in financial services, one of the most stable and lucrative industries in the world!

My name is Chris, founder and owner of The Leake Agency, and we are looking for INDEPENDENT LIFE INSURANCE AGENTS who are ready to learn the business, work hard, have fun, and finally earn what you’re worth.

Work remotely from anywhere, part time or full time, set your own schedule, build your own agency, no limit on your income. No experience necessary.

People on our team are winning! And having tons of fun doing it! And we have room for YOU.

This is a 1099 independently contracted commission selling position. You will be selling life insurance ONLY to people who have already reached out and asked for someone to help them with life insurance. (No cold calling.)

✅ Full-Time = 35-45 hours per week and can earn $7,000-$12,000+++ per month.

✅ Part-Time = 15-20 hours per week and can earn $2,500-$5,000+ per month.


DISCLAIMER: No agent’s success, earnings, or production results should be viewed as typical, average, or expected. Not all agents achieve the same or similar results, and no particular results are guaranteed. Your level of success will be determined by several factors, including the amount of work you put in, your ability to successfully follow and implement our training and sales system and engage with our lead system, and the insurance needs of the customers in the geographic areas in which you choose to work.


Highlights
❌ NO cold calling, and NO bugging friends and family to buy from you
❌ NO network marketing
❌ NO membership fees, dues, franchise fees, etc.
❌ NO sales quotas, no condescending bosses, no sleazy sales tactics, no neckties (unless that's your thing)

✔️ Hands-on training and mentoring from me and our team of very successful agents
✔️ Be part of a vibrant, growth-oriented, successful team that embraces new members like family
✔️ We provide you people to talk to who already asked for help with life insurance
✔️ Commissions paid out daily directly to you by our insurance carriers
✔️ Remote work and in-person training opportunities available
✔️ Earn a raise every 1-2 months
✔️ Health insurance available
✔️ Opportunity to own your own agency (if desired, not required)
✔️ Earn bonuses, get lots of personal recognition, earn amazing trips to 5-star resorts


Some of Our Successful Team Members Include...
💊 -- A former pharmacy tech and mom of two young children who replaced her full-time income, earned several thousand dollars in each of her first three full months, PLUS $7k in bonuses, PLUS earned three raises

🔨 -- A former remodeling company director of operations who replaced his full-time income and gained contractual ownership of his own life insurance agency within his first 8 months

👨🏫 -- A former pastor and current part-time teacher who sells insurance part time and nets $2k-$6k per month while supporting his wife and young son

🍺 -- A former bartender and musician who now works remotely, travels, and earns over $12k per month

👨👧👦 -- A former burned out retail manager who now owns his own business, makes $8k-$12k per month and is building a legacy for his two kids


⚠️ This is NOT for you if: ⚠️
--You want a W-2 employee job earning an hourly wage or salary
--You’re looking for a get rich quick scheme
--You don’t already have an insurance license OR you’re not willing to study for two weeks and spend a couple of hundred dollars to get one
--You don’t care about other people or you’re willing to do unethical things to get what you want

✅ This MIGHT be for you if: ✅
++You want more out of life than what's average
++You are humble, coachable, and teachable
++You have the self-discipline to put in the work needed without someone looking over your shoulder
++You’re a high character person who cares about others and does the right thing
++Money isn’t the end game for you, but it’s a powerful means to freedom, helping others, and building a great life for you and your loved ones


Our Story
Three years ago I was burned out after two failed businesses, in debt, and struggling to provide for my wife and 4 kids. I got introduced to the insurance business and, frankly, I was skeptical. It sounded too good to be true. And I had no experience whatsoever in financial services or in sales. 🤔

But I’m a hard worker, I like people, and it seemed like a good company. So I decided to give it a shot. It was plenty of work learning a brand new industry and new skills, but so very worth it. Everything I had been told about the industry was absolutely true, and even more. 🔥

Fast forward to today and I’m making almost twice as much money as I’d dared to hope I’d be making by now, I can take 2-3 weeks off in the summer and around the holidays or whenever I want to do family stuff, and I'm building my own life insurance agency that I own. Best of all, my growing team and I have been able to train many other new agents in the business, teach them the same things we've learned, and help them achieve success as well. 🚀

I hope you’re the next person we get to help launch to success! You’ve heard the old saying, “It’s not WHAT you know, it’s WHO you know.” Deep down inside you’ve known there was something better for you. You’ve just been waiting to get connected to the right people. 💯

Maybe you’ve been burned and you’re skeptical like I was. I get it. But don’t let past failures or disappointments keep you from your greatest breakthrough. If you're the person who is feeling something inside as you read this ad, you're the person we've been looking for. Come join our team and find your home. 💪🏽


📝 HOW TO APPLY
To learn more and to schedule an interview, click the link below or copy and paste it into your browser:

https://build.theleakeagency.com/

We look forward to hearing from you and getting your journey started towards a better life!


.

.

.

.

.

.

.

.

.

title: BUSSER OPENINGS AT LILLIAN'S

* Be able to work in a standing position for long periods of time (up to 5 hours).

title: 1:1 Support for Adult Male with Developmental Disabilities
description:
Cedars of Marin (www.cedarslife.org) provides day programs and residential opportunities for adults with developmental disabilities. Cedars began in 1919, and for more than a century our person-centered programs and services have supported hundreds of clients in living creative, productive, joyous and healthy lives.

We are seeking a full-time 1:1 in our Community Connections program (www.cedarslife.org/community-connections) to work directly with an individual, providing support for him to participate in various activities including music and arts & crafts. You will help with the oversight of his day to day functions, and provide support in a manner that ensures his health, safety and happiness.

Hours are Monday – Friday, 8:00 am - 3:00 pm.

General Qualifications:
1. Experience in supporting adults with developmental disabilities is strongly desired.
2. Desire to help others achieve their full potential.
3. Medical background, skills, and terminology is a plus. 
4. Ability to think ahead and take initiative.
5. English communication skills, both written and verbal.
6. The ability to drive a passenger van. A valid CA driver's license and 3 years of driving experience.
7. Proficient in the use of email.
8. CPR and First Aid certifications or the willingness to acquire both.
9. Ability to pass an occupational employment physical including a TB test, and meet the physical requirements of the job.
10. Ability to pass a criminal background check with the FBI and DOJ.


Benefits for full-time (30+ hours/week), regular employees:
1. Medical, Dental, Vision
2. (403B) with matching of $.50 on the $1.00 on a tenure scale
3. Paid Vacation, Sick, 3 Personal Days and 10 paid Holidays
4. Flexible Spending Account Plan
5. Employee Assistance Program
6. Employer paid Life/ADD insurance policy
7. Employer paid Long Term Disability Insurance

To apply, please email your resume & cover letter and type "1:1 Support” in the subject line.


Diversity Statement:
The Cedars of Marin does not discriminate on the basis of disability status in the admission or access to, or treatment or employment in its federally assisted programs and activities. The person named below has been designated to coordinate compliance with the nondiscrimination requirements contained in the Department of Housing and Urban Development's regulations implementing Section 504 (24 CFR, part 8, dated 6/2/88. Katherine Noel, P.O. Box 947, Ross, CA 94957, 415-455-1715, ext. 356, TTY 800-735-2929 or 711.

title: Kitchen Trainer: Culinary Production
description:
Job Announcement
Please call 415-382-3363 ext. 225. Craigslist does not allow email address included in this posting.

Title:                              Kitchen Trainer: Culinary Production    

Regular Schedule         Monday – Friday 8:30AM – 5PM
                                       Some evenings and weekends when required.
                                        
Exempt – Salary	    $70K annual   
                                                          
Reports to:                 Director or Training and Kitchen Operations   

Start Date:                  ASAP

The Opportunity:

Homeward Bound of Marin is a dynamic and evolving non-profit agency dedicated to ending homelessness in Marin County through affordable housing development, supportive services, job training, and social enterprise. With a successful 49-year history and strong interdisciplinary partnerships with both private and public organizations, Homeward Bound is poised for impactful growth over the next decade. Our work environment places a strong emphasis on Justice, Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion (JEDI) values and rewards qualities such as resourcefulness, flexibility, kindness, compassion, and understanding.
Homeward Bound offers culinary training to individuals facing barriers to regular employment through the operation of the Fresh Starts Culinary Academy (FSCA). FSCA is an American Culinary Federation (ACF)-certified training program designed to provide industry-certified culinary arts training to those with barriers to employment, equipping them with the skills needed for jobs in the food service and hospitality industries. We hire FSCA graduates into four related culinary "social enterprise" businesses, including an events and catering center, monthly celebrity chef demonstration dinners, daily mass contract meal production, and a line of high-end dog treats.
Homeward Bound is seeking a Kitchen Trainer to provide hands-on, on-the-job, culinary instruction to students and kitchen employees, while also working in a production role in these social enterprise businesses. The Kitchen trainer will help to provide mentorship, organization, and a nurturing approach to training in the Wagster Treats business and our kitchens.
The Kitchen Trainer will work closely with the Head Chefs in the production and catering kitchens, and the Director of Training & Culinary Operations, to create a holistic training and learning environment.
So, if you have a heart and passion for our work and you have culinary training experience, we want to hear from you! 
The Candidate:

We are looking for a culinary professional who has a passion for teaching and is looking to work a mainly daytime schedule, while contributing to a vibrant nonprofit with a strong business acumen.

.Education or Training Equivalent to:
 	Bachelor’s Degree, Culinary Arts Degree, and equivalent kitchen experience; at least 3 to 5 years of experience in professional food service management.
 	A demonstrated teaching style reflecting compassion, wisdom, and integrity.
 	Experience and preferred commitment to teaching people who are disadvantaged and who have barriers to learning.
 	Clear and organized communication which fosters a cohesive team environment.
 	Committed to the mission of Homeward Bound of Marin
 	Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including computer skills.
 	Demonstrated energy and a passion for excellence, teamwork, and creating success.
 	Ability to maintain an effective learning environment to keep instruction on track in the classroom and in the kitchens.
 	Self-starter who takes appropriate initiative, has excellent time management and organization skills, creative and has a sense of humor. 
 	ACF certification or certification eligible

Special Qualifications, Qualities & Physical Requirements (skills, abilities, licenses):
 	Committed to the mission of Homeward Bound of Marin.
 	To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.
 	Ability to stand for extended periods of time (6 – 8 hours per day)
 	Ability to sit, and use a computer mouse, keyboard, and monitor, for moderate periods of time (1 – 3 hours per day)
 	Ability to stoop, crouch, kneel, and/or crawl on occasion.
 	Ability to lift and/or move objects weighing up to 25 pounds.
 	High level of awareness and comfort working in a culturally and ethnically diverse work environment 
 	Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 

Major Responsibilities: 
 	Plans, prepares, and executes meal production, and train staff on kitchen techniques, inventory management and hygiene standards.  
 	Hands -on role to prepare students to be successful in a food service work environment.

Wagster Oversite:
 	Provide oversite, as needed, in the daily Wagster Dog Treat production process.
 	Help problem solving and treat manufacturing, baking, and staff issues as they arise.
 	Assist to create and utilize training procedures and materials. 

Kitchen Production:
 	Participate in hands on production and on the job training to kitchen employees, students and volunteers while working in the production, catering, and shelter kitchens. 
 	Mentor transitional employees as they prepare and order food in the shelter kitchens.
 	Produce food of consistently high quality, taste, and presentation.
 	Expedite production and service during periods of demand as needed.
 	Guide kitchen employees in maintaining a consistent clean environment including all equipment, walk-ins, floors, hoods, etc.

Training Program Support:
 	Provide hands-on direct training with students and employees on core kitchen competencies.
 	Train students and employees on following, modifying,  and adapting recipes to meet production needs.
 	Teach culinary classroom lectures, as applicable.
 	Help students and transitional employees with job search including application process, as applicable.
 	Participate in bi-monthly Job Readiness Assessment (JRA) with each student, as applicable.
 	Maintains and models confidentiality related to all client, student, and resident services as well as any personnel-related issues.

Relationships:
 	Establishes and maintains open, supportive, and collaborative relationships with instructors, directors, managers, board members, and all other staff members.
 	Maintain effective communication and working relationships with kitchen and program staff.
 	Responsive to staff suggestions and concerns. Work to resolve issues.
 	Work with HB team to build a network of businesses, create a FSCA Advisory Board to support FSCA graduates for job placement and retention.
 	Greets, communicates, and treats all clients, customers, and students with respect, dignity, and an attitude of service.
 	Maintains and models confidentiality related to all client, student, and resident services as well as any personnel-related issues.

Written & Verbal Communication Skills:
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Demonstrated ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups and individuals.
Equal Opportunity: 
Homeward Bound is an equal opportunity employer. We stand for justice and equity. We celebrate diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, and training.

Competitive Benefits:
 	100 % Employer Paid Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance 
 	403 B match
 	120 accrued vacation hours (2 weeks); prorated for part-time employees. 
 	13 paid holidays off 
 	12 Sick days annually (prorated for part-time employees)
 	Employee Assistance Program 

To Apply:
Send resumes: Lee Callero 415 382-3363 ext 225 Craigslist does not allow email address on the posting.

*$70K annual DOE with a competitive benefits package which includes 100% employer paid medical and dental insurance, 80 accrued vacation hours, and access to a 403b retirement plan. title: Caregivers needed for 32-year-old disabled woman
description:
I am significantly disabled and use a wheelchair. I am 32-years-old with a fairly active social life. I am able to drive my own vehicle.

I am looking for caregiver(s) to assist me with the following shifts: 

SHIFT 1:
EVERY OTHER SATURDAY TO SUNDAY in San Martin, CA with evening, overnight, morning, and a swim routine. This job is for alternating weekends and is extremely flexible. Generally, schedules begin at 5 PM on Saturdays until 2 PM on Sundays. San Martin is between Morgan Hill and Gilroy.

SHIFT 2:
Alternating Saturdays from 10 am to 3 pm. Shift includes a swim routine. 

$20 an hour in cash and a $60 flat fee for the overnight. I do not require overnight care, so you will be able to sleep through the night. Caregivers get their own room and private bathroom. My activities include meal prep, swimming in my accessible pool, dressing, showering and bathroom care. I also need people to help me if I'd like to go out, such as to the store or visiting my friends. My transfer from wheelchair to toilet does not require lifting; however, caregivers should feel comfortable being able to lift 40 pounds.

Experience working in home-health care is not required but is preferred. Any experience working with people with disabilities is a plus. All cis and trans women along with non-binary people are welcome to apply. Individuals who live within 30 minutes of my location are will be prioritized.

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS
1. You must be over the age of 18
2. You must be able to drive and have a valid driver’s license
3. You must be fully vaccinated for Covid

APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS:
If interested, please provide:
1. Your name and interest in this job.
2. A resume and/or references (home care experience is not required, but is preferred)
3. Your phone number so we can arrange a phone interview.

INTERVIEW REQUIREMENTS
If you are selected for an interview, I need to see:
1. A copy of a valid ID such as a state driver’s license or passport. I need to make sure you are over 18.
2. I also need to see proof of full vaccination, such as a completed Covid 19 vaccine card.

title: Tartine Manufactory Is Hiring A Day-Time Sous Chef!
description:
Tartine Manufactory is committed to creating a lasting legacy through hospitality and experience in our communities. Delivering things you have seen before in a way you have never experienced, from a warm loaf of bread to a hot cup of coffee.

We are looking for an exceptional & experienced Sous Chef who loves to work with our People, our People Ops Department, our Leadership &amp our culinary team. In addition to general duties, this person will be responsible for ensuring a smooth and efficient service. Responsible for all food production, including restaurants, banquet functions, and other outlets. Develop menus with the culinary team, food purchase specifications, and recipes. Supervise staff. Develop and monitor the food and labor budget for the department. Maintain the highest professional food quality and sanitation standards.

You are part of the leadership team, come start your career with us! We take care of you.

Job Type: Full-time 

Salary: $68,000.00 DOE

Please respond to this ad with an updated resume, including your full name, contact number, and email address. Your updated resume must also include your most recent employers with dates of employment.

Click to apply:  https://recruiting.myapps.paychex.com/appone/MainInfoReq.asp?R_ID=5980797

Benefits:

401(k)
Life Insurance
100% Paid Health Care, Dental and Vision Insurance
Paid time off
80 hours of accrued vacation in the first year

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

o Interview, select, train, supervise, counsel, and discipline all employees in the department.
o Provide, develop, train, and maintain a professional workforce.
o Ensure all services to members are conducted in a highly professional and efficient manner.
o Ensure a safe working environment and attitude on the part of all employees in areas of responsibility.
o Develop and implement an annual budget for the kitchen to include, food, labor, and other costs.
o Prepares necessary data for applicable parts of the budget; projects annual food, labor, and other costs and monitors actual financial results; takes corrective action as necessary to help ensure that financial goals are met.
o Act with integrity, honesty, and knowledge to promote the culture, values, and mission of Tartine
o Contribute to creating a culture and work environment based on respect; providing opportunities for staff to learn, grow, and develop their abilities
o Plan menus for restaurant and catering.
o Schedule and coordinate the work of chefs, cooks and other kitchen employees to assure that food preparation is economical and technically correct and within budgeted labor cost goals.
o Approve the requisition of products and other necessary food supplies.
o Ensure that high standards of sanitation, cleanliness and safety are maintained throughout all kitchen areas at all times.
o Establish controls to minimize food and supply waste and theft.
o Safeguard all food preparation employees by implementing training to increase their knowledge about safety, sanitation and accident prevention principles.
o Develop standard recipes and techniques for food preparation and presentation which help to assure consistence in high quality and to minimize food costs; exercise portion control for all items served and assist in establishing menu selling prices.
o Attend food and beverage staff and management meetings.
o Consult with the FOH managers about food production aspects of special events being planned.
o Cook or directly supervise the cooking of items that require skillful preparation.
o Ensure proper staffing for maximum productivity and high standards of quality; control food and payroll costs to achieve maximum profitability.
o Evaluate food products to assure that quality standards are consistently attained.
o Interact with food and beverage management to assure that food production consistently exceeds the expectations of guests.
o In conjunction with director of culinary and director of operations, assist in maintaining a high level of service principles in accordance with established standards.
o Evaluate products to assure that quality, price and related goods are consistently met, including the utilization of technology like Plate IQ
o Develop policies and procedures to enhance and measure quality; continually update written policies and procedures to reflect state-of-the-art techniques, equipment and terminology.
o Establish and maintain a regular cleaning and maintenance schedule for all kitchen areas and equipment.
o Provide training and professional development opportunities for all kitchen staff.
o Ensure that representatives from the kitchen attend service lineups and meetings.
o Support safe work habits and a safe working environment at all times.
o Perform other duties as directed.

***Other Duties
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Supplemental

Empowered to take decisions regarding culinary
Manage daily and monthly kitchen activities
Manage annual culinary budget
Work with the management team to champion performance improvement
Provide guidance and direction to staff including setting performance standards and monitoring performance

***Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, performing and coordinating a variety of duties and tasks for the restaurant.

Minimum Qualifications:

o Five or more years of experience in varied kitchen positions including food preparation, line cook, fry cook, and expediter
o At least 6 months experience in a similar capacity
o Able to communicate effectively with managers, kitchen and dining room personnel, and guests
o Able to reach, bend, stoop and frequently lift up to 50 pounds
o Able to work in a standing position for long periods of time (up to 9 hours)
o At least 3-5 years’ experience as a working Executive Chef or Chef de Cuisine
o BA preferred
o Excellent verbal, analytical, organizational, and written skills
o Competent computer skills including email, Word, Excel and other software

AAP / EEO Statement

We are an equal opportunity employer.

title: Seeking Experienced General Manager & Manager for Upscale Lounge
description:
Compensation: Salary
Employment type: full-time

Madarae Lounge is currently seeking experienced General Manager and Assistant General Manager. We are looking for a motivated individual with strong work ethic and is impeccably responsible to join our team.

Manager is responsible for: 
* Strong focus on guest satisfaction 
* Managing/leading activities of the staff 
* Proactively executing flawless guest satisfaction 
* Inspiring the staff to look at job responsibilities through the guest perspective
* Manage day to day operations for cocktail lounge and boutique nightclub
* Work closely with chef and bar manager on both food and mixology program

The ideal candidate will have: 
* A minimum of 3 years experience in a high-volume upscale dining, bar or lounge
* Proactive guest issue prevention/guest relations skills 
* Knowledge of restaurant POS system management operations 
* An open availability is desirable (days, nights, weekends) 
* Must be committed to our mission and culture
* A passion for hospitality, a love for cocktails, food, nightlife and a positive demeanor
* Attention to details, cleanliness and safety

Typical Responsibilities:
*Manage day to day operations in a high-volume environment
*Ensure company policies and procedures are met
*Schedule and appoint tasks and responsibilities to staff
*Inventory, ordering and upholding restaurant maintenance and appearance
*Demonstrated leadership skills
*Guest-focused and service-driven  
 

About MADARAE:
Situated on Minna Street, the original Harlot drew it’s inspiration from local legend; San Francisco alleys named after famous Barbary Coast harlots. This latest incarnation of an SF institution delves deeper into the legend and the history of this special place at 46 Minna Street. Over the decades the space went through various iterations, serving as a leftist HQ & printing press, a sake bootlegging operation & speakeasy during prohibition, post-war illegal jazz club, even a pirate radio station from the Summer of Love through Punk and Hip-hop eras. But throughout the space’s many lives it remained a vital, dynamic gathering place. It’s leadership passed from one female entrepreneur to another, carrying on it’s traditions and hospitality to the creative underground. Now it’s colorful past is celebrated and reimagined as a future secret clubhouse inviting those creators & dreamers lucky enough to discover it.

​Welcome to MADARAE.

MADARAE offers comprehensive employee benefits package including:
• Room for advancement in an established and growing restaurant group
• Offers health benefits
• Flexible hours
• Paid Sick Leave and Paid Time Off
• Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Benefits
• Compassionate team members
• Transparent and open communication
• Positive and respectful work environment where diversity is valued

If you are interested, please email us with the following:
• A copy of your resume
• Tell us a bit about yourself
• Your availability

Thanks again for your time and your interest in joining our team!

title: Field Service Equipment Technician
description:
Apply Now: http://careerwebapp.us/field-service-equipment-technician-san-jose-morgan-hill-watsonville

No Experience Necessary, will train the right candidate.

SUMMARY
Technicians will be held to a high standard of service. Technicians are required to service commercial beverage equipment such as coffee brewers, coffee grinders, espresso machines, ice tea machines, etc... Individuals in this role are provided with: a vehicle, uniforms, tools, cell phone, and gas card. Benefits provided are sick time off, paid vacation leave, medical insurance available, and 401K.

REQUIREMENTS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Receive dispatched service calls as assigned and ensure prompt response based on estimated time of arrival (ETA).
Troubleshoot or diagnose equipment malfunctions utilizing standard electrical test equipment such as volt/ohm meters to identify and implement corrective action and perform preventative maintenance. Check calibration and ensure machine is clean.
Maintain inventory and maintenance on equipment such as: parts and tools
Review service orders and service performed with your supervisor. Must keep managers informed of customer concerns, and needs.
Document all work performed and close out all activities upon completion.
In some locations, the Service Technician will be responsible for machine movement and various other duties as assigned.
Must be able to work overtime when needed.

COMPETENCIES
To perform this job successfully, the Service Technician must be self-motivated and have the ability to stay on task with minimal to no supervision. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.

Mechanical aptitude.
Customer relations, interpersonal relationships, team relations and service.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Must be self-starter and be able to accomplish tasks in a timely manner.
Great oral and written communication skills.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Will consider any candidate with mechanical aptitude. In-house and factory training will be provided on various equipment.
Graduate of Technical or Vocational School a plus.
Valid driverâ€™s license and clean driving record a must.
Ability to lift 55 lbs or more on a regular basis. Occasional lifting in excess of 70 lbs required.
Ability to drive more than 40% of the time.
Ability to pass a Background Check.
Must have non-skid (slip resistant) shoes .

Submit resume and include hobbies.

$$ Salary depends on experience

Apply Now: http://careerwebapp.us/field-service-equipment-technician-san-jose-morgan-hill-watsonville

title: $50/hr Admin and HR
description:
Heads up: Please read the entire ad and then comply with application requirements so that your application will catch our attention! Please follow these two simple steps:

To Apply

1. Attach your resume in a PDF Word document with full contact details including email, residential address, and phone number.
2. Include an originally written, non-generic, non-AI cover letter describing why this is personally a great position for you. In the cover letter, please also refer specifically to the requirements described in the ad and why you are a match for the majority of those requirements. 

The Job

We are a small, boutique, very organized, cohesive team looking for an executive-level, experienced professional administrator with strong HR background to help us in our Supported Living Services agency. You will be working flexible hours in our cozy Novato office and remotely as needed, as a direct report to the Executive Director, administering, hiring and retaining companions for adults with developmental disabilities. You must live in Marin County or within 15 miles or approximately a 15-minute drive to Marin County, because some of the meetings are on-call.

The position requirements include:
Professional administration experience at the highest level of literacy and competence
Willingness and proven ability to lead firmly, confidently and compassionately
Knowledge of SSI, SSA, Section 8, recertification, EBT
Being a self-starter who is pro-active, meticulous, and self-accountable for deadlines and responsibilities
Document completions, writing and placing ads, managing resumes, interviewing, hiring, onboarding, off boarding, training, corrections, conflict, records, and retention
Google Docs, basic spreadsheets, time sheets and basic Quickbooks
Knowledge of California labor law and HR
High level of intelligence and flexibility
Background in caregiving agency a plus
Bachelor's Degree
Glowing references

You will be the right-hand person, direct report, assistant, and team mate to the Executive Director. We are a small agency so the job will include higher level administration as well as HR. The needs of the position are not specialized strictly to HR.

The personality best suited for this position is one of warmth, leadership and strength, firm committment to agency policy and labor law, stalwart protection of the agency and our clients, as well as the spirit of care, kindness and assistance for our incredible employees. An unfailing sense of humor in the face of the unexpected will serve you well in this job. Fitting in with our remarkable team is a priority.

Pay and Benefits

You will be offered:
$50.00 an hour, for approximately 10-15 hours a week depending upon what comes up. These hours will vary and may change as the job expands or contracts.
$20 a month toward your data plan
.67 a mile for all miles driven for work
You will have an option of signing up for CalSavers IRA plan which we will administer for you
40 hours of sick leave
Health insurance premium paid up to set amount after six months
Discretionary bonuses

COVID 19 Policy
We work in a frontline, state-funded caregiving agency. The COVID-19 vaccine and all current boosters and vaccines now and in the future are required with no exceptions.

We look forward to hearing from you!




Search Keywords: HR, Human Resources, Administration, Administrator, Management, Caregiving, Executive, Manager

Preschool Teacher Job Summary

A Preschool Teacher that works for Creative Hearts must share a passion for children and a passion for education. The Preschool Teacher provides a structured academic setting to ensure students are at the kindergarten readiness level when leaving the program. The Preschool Teacher plans and implements activities that promote the social, physical, and intellectual growth of all children. He/she is responsible for the care, hygiene, learning, and developmental activities, and specialized programs. Communicates directly with parents regarding their child’s accomplishments, academic progress, and daily activities. Maintains classroom records, cleanliness, and orderliness.

Responsible for the safety of all children in the group

Demonstrated skill in early childhood curriculum and implementation

Ability to provide love and nurturing environment for all children

Bachelor's Degree in Education and/or teaching certificate is highly desired.

title: Personal Trainer - Part Time
description:
Position Title:  Personal Trainer - Part Time
Location:  2255 Clement Street, San Francisco, CA 94121

About The Culture SF

At The Culture SF, we are more than just a gym – we're a vibrant fitness community nestled in the heart of the Central Richmond district. Founded with passion and dedication by Lerocman Hall and Mariea Santiago on September 10, 2023, our establishment stands on the corner of 24th and Clement Street. We offer a welcoming and inclusive space, celebrating diversity and fostering a sense of unity.

Our mission is to empower individuals on their fitness journey, providing access to cutting-edge equipment, personalized training sessions, and an array of wellness programs. With a commitment to inclusivity, we strive to cultivate an environment where everyone feels supported and motivated to achieve their fitness goals.

At The Culture SF, we take pride in being a minority-owned business, contributing to the vibrant tapestry of our community. Whether you're a fitness enthusiast, a beginner, or simply looking for a supportive environment to kickstart your health journey, join us and be part of a thriving fitness culture dedicated to your well-being.

POSITION SUMMARY
The Culture SF Personal Trainers provide individualized programming and instruction to each client to achieve the member's health, fitness, and wellness goals. At the same time, Personal Trainers provide the highest level of customer service. Join us to discover a dynamic work environment built around helping others maximize their potential.

We are seeking a committed and friendly personal trainer to help members regain fitness levels and be reliable resources for their fitness journey.

Responsibilities:
Build a clientele base through conducting fitness assessments and affirming the value of personal training while demonstrating and teaching safe and proper exercise techniques.
Prepare and deliver comprehensive fitness programs based on clients' goals and needs.
Perform goal setting, frequent follow-ups, body composition testing, and re-assessments to retain PT clientele.
Assist in all revenue-generating activities, including but not limited to complimentary workouts, seminars, and workshops, and support your club manager as needed.
Be responsible for achieving personal monthly revenue objectives set forth by the company.
Demonstrate organizational and time-management skills.
Possess the ability to adjust and operate all fitness equipment appropriately.
Present an enthusiastic, passionate, friendly, and ambitious attitude and work ethic.
Promote the Culture SF brand via social media marketing on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram.
Follow City and State guidelines regarding COVID precautions and procedures.
Trainers must be adaptable to changes as needed.

Undertake other duties as assigned. 

Required Qualifications
A Nationally Accredited Personal Training Certification or a 4-year degree in a related field of study.
A CPR/AED certification from the American Red Cross or a licensed ARC provider.
A high-school diploma or GED.
Must be open to flexible hours, including early morning sessions. 
Familiarity with and ability to safely operate fitness equipment.

Preferred Qualifications:
A strong background in and proven record of demonstrating high-level customer service.
1+ years of sales experience.
1+ years of Personal Training experience, including conducting fitness assessments and selling personal training packages.
Demonstrable written and verbal communication skills and a high emotional intelligence quotient.
A strong understanding of the scientific principles underlying human movement and performance.
An ability to self-promote and market on social media platforms and through active networking endeavors.

The pay may depend on skills and qualifications. $40-$50 hourly.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider all qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

The Culture SF is dedicated to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all employees and applicants. We strictly prohibit any discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability, genetics, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected characteristic in accordance with federal, state, or local laws.

At The Culture SF, we are committed to creating a diverse team that represents our community. We encourage candidates from underrepresented communities to apply and be part of our inclusive environment. Your unique perspective is highly valued.


Please submit your resume to admin@theculturesf.com

title: Housing Counselor or Staff Attorney
description:
JOB POSTING: Housing Counselor or Staff Attorney (Full-Time, Spanish preferred)

ORGANIZATION OVERVIEW
Fair Housing Advocates of Northern California (FHANC) is a private non-profit organization. FHANC’s mission is to increase diversity in the communities it serves and to maximize housing opportunities for all persons regardless of disability, race, color, religion, national origin, familial status, gender, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, occupation, ancestry, source of income, immigration status, or other protected class.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
- Provide direct fair housing counseling services in English (and Spanish, if applicable) to tenants and homeowners who have experienced housing discrimination and/or clients with disabilities who require reasonable accommodations by providing advice to clients, advocacy/intervention on behalf of clients, and representation of clients in administrative complaints to HUD and/or the California Civil Rights Department
- Assist Supervising Attorney with lawsuits and/or collaborate with counsel of record to support agency lawsuits
- Assist in education and outreach efforts, including presenting fair housing trainings for housing providers, social service providers, advocacy organizations, and/or community members; attending community and advocacy organization meetings, municipal/local government hearings and/or housing authority meetings; preparing comments on policy issues on behalf of the organization; and engaging in other relevant outreach events as appropriate
- In collaboration with management, implement programs designed to meet various grant goals and compile data for quarterly reports; contribute to drafting new grant proposals

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
- Juris Doctor (for staff attorney position only)
- Commitment to fair housing and civil rights; knowledge of federal and state fair housing laws desirable
- Excellent oral communication skills, including public speaking and interpersonal skills
- Excellent written communication skills
- Strong analytical and organization skills and ability to manage multiple cases
- Self-motivation and ability to meet project deadlines and maintain accurate records
- Ability to work effectively with a diverse community and with patience, tact, and respect when interacting with the public and other staff
- Ability to access, read, and interpret legal documents, federal and state fair housing statutes and regulations
- Ability to conduct trainings for fair housing professionals, government agencies, and industry groups
- Ability to represent FHANC effectively in a professional and exceptional manner
- Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, Salesforce, PowerPoint, and other software desirable

EQUITY STATEMENT
FHANC is committed to fostering a diverse staff and we seek to fill this position with someone who shares our values, including our organizational commitment to diversity. We recognize that organizations may miss out on strong applicants who screen themselves out of the process because they do not meet every qualification and that disproportionately impacts people from historically marginalized backgrounds. If you find that you meet many of the qualifications in the job description, we encourage you to apply. A welcoming, inclusive, and culturally diverse staff allows us to best serve our community.

SALARY
Salary will be in the range of $60,000 - $80,000, dependent on Spanish-speaking ability, admission to the California Bar, and experience. Benefits and paid vacation time included.

Our current work model is a remote/in-office hybrid, with occasional in-person work required. Proof of completed Covid-19 vaccination, including eligible booster(s), will be required for all employees (With the exception of reasonable accommodations due to medical or religious beliefs).

To apply please submit resume and cover letter to Julia @ fairhousingnorcal.org and Peattie @ fairhousingnorcal.org. Applications will be accepted until the position is filled. No calls please.
