title: Lead Spanish Language Counselor
description:
Are you passionate about HOUSING JUSTICE?
Do you want to support Spanish speaking tenants to know their rights? 
Do you want to join a diverse, multilingual tenant organization fighting for TENANT POWER? 

Job Description: Lead Spanish Language Counselor 

The Housing Rights Committee of San Francisco (HRCSF) is a tenants’ rights non-profit serving tenants citywide since 1979, offering free counseling and organizing support for San Francisco tenants in all types of housing, including rent-control, public housing, and Section 8. Our purpose is to strengthen tenants’ rights, improve living conditions for renters, and preserve and expand affordable housing opportunities. Through our counseling program, we support more than 5,000 tenants a year, and our organizing program has helped build five tenant associations across the city since 2019. 

Position Summary: 
Under the direct supervision of the Counseling Department Director, the Lead Spanish Language Tenant Counselor is responsible for implementing Housing Rights Committee’s tenant counseling work throughout the city with problems ranging from illegal rent increases and evictions to lack of repairs and non-return of security deposits as well as supervising and supporting the Spanish language staff and volunteer counselors and representing our counseling with external partner organizations.

Key Responsibilities: 
• Supervise, train, and assist staff and counseling volunteers to support Spanish speaking tenants city-wide
• Hold drop-in hours for tenants and support with tenant counseling calls as necessary 
• Field calls to help tenants write letters, request and document tenant needs and educate individual tenants on their rights and options regarding repairs, unfair evictions, rent increases, retaliation, discrimination, and harassment. 
• Connect tenants with local organizations and legal services.
• Assist with English to Spanish translations for written outreach materials. 
• Recruit and train volunteers who help with tenant counseling.
• Represent HRCSF externally in the press, with coalition and city department meetings as needed 
• Work closely with organizing staff to engage tenants and residents and workers in efforts to ensure long term equity and social justice, including with outreach efforts like flyering 
• Other administrative and organizational tasks as needed such as attending all internal meetings and trainings and supporting with organizational events as needed

Qualifications: 
• Knowledge of issues impacting tenants in San Francisco. 
• Demonstrated commitment to social justice, housing and/or worker justice
• Ability to lead a team while still being an effective team-mate and working independently when necessary
• High level of verbal and written fluency in Spanish and English.
• Ability to conduct public meetings and tenants rights workshops.
• Strong organizational and communications skills.
• Flexibility to work some evenings and weekends.
• Experience with City of San Francisco grant reporting preferred.

This position is a full-time exempt position with a current salary of $66,560.  Benefits include medical, dental, and vision including chiropractic and acupuncture, and a generous accrual of paid vacations and sick time. This is a 40-hour in-person  position. HRCSF is a caring work environment that centers on self and collective care to ensure we are all here for the long haul! 

To apply, send a resume and cover letter to resume@hrcsf.org  Lead Spanish Language Counselor in the subject line. 

HRCSF is an equal opportunity employer: people of color, women, immigrants, LGBTQI2S, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply! Diverse viewpoints are vital to our organization's mission and culture.  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

¿Te apasiona la JUSTICIA DE VIVIENDA?
¿Quieres apoyar a inquilines hispanohablantes a conocer sus derechos?
¿Quiere unirse a una organización de inquilines diversa y multilingüe que lucha por el PODER DE LOS INQUILINES?

Descripción del puesto: Consejere Líder Hispanohablante 

El Comité de Derechos de Vivienda de San Francisco (HRCSF) es una organización sin fines de lucro que defiende los derechos de  inquilines y provee servicios a inquilines a través de toda la ciudad desde 1979, ofreciendo consejería gratuita y apoyo organizativo para los inquilines de San Francisco en todo tipo de viviendas, incluyendo  unidades bajo el control de renta, viviendas públicas y Sección 8. Nuestro propósito es fortalecer los derechos de los inquilines,  mejorar las condiciones de vida de los inquilines y preservar y ampliar las oportunidades de vivienda asequible. A través de nuestro programa de consejería, apoyamos a más de 5000 inquilinos al año y nuestro programa de organización ha ayudado a construir cinco asociaciones de inquilinos en toda la ciudad desde 2019.

Resumen de posición:
Bajo la supervisión directa del Director del Departamento de Consejería, el Consejere Líder Hispanohablante es responsable de implementar el trabajo de consejeria para inquilines a través de la ciudad con problemas que van desde aumentos ilegales de renta y desalojos, hasta falta de reparaciones y falta de devolución de depósitos. Adicionalmente, supervisar y apoyar al personal de consejería hispanohablante y a los consejeros voluntarios y representar nuestro a nuestra organizaciones en espacios externos.

Responsabilidades clave:
• Supervisar, capacitar y ayudar al personal y a los voluntarios de consejería hispanohablantes
• Mantener horarios de visita sin cita previa para inquilines y apoyar con llamadas de consejería según sea necesario
• Responder a llamadas y ayudar a inquilines a escribir cartas, solicitar y documentar sus necesidades y educarlos sobre sus derechos individuales y opciones con respecto a reparaciones, desalojos injustos, aumentos de renta, represalias, discriminación y acoso.
• Conectar a inquilines con organizaciones locales y servicios legales.
• Ayudar con las traducciones escritas del inglés al español de materiales de alcance.
• Reclutar y capacitar a voluntarios que ayuden con la consejería de inquilines. 
• Representar al Comité de Vivienda externamente en la prensa, en reuniones de coalición y con departamentos de la ciudad según sea necesario.
• Trabajar colaborativamente con el personal de organización para involucrar a inquilines, residentes y trabajadores en los esfuerzos por garantizar la equidad y la justicia social a largo plazo, incluso con esfuerzos de alcance como la distribución de folletos. 
• Otras tareas administrativas y organizativas según sea necesario, como asistir a todas las reuniones y capacitaciones internas y apoyar con eventos organizacionales según sea necesario. 

Calificaciones:
• Conocimiento de los problemas que afectan a los inquilines en San Francisco.
• Compromiso demostrado a la justicia social, de vivienda y/o la justicia. 
• Capacidad para dirigir un equipo de manera cooperativa y eficaz, poder trabajar en equipo e independientemente cuando sea necesario.
• Alto nivel de fluidez verbal y escrita en español e inglés.
• Capacidad para realizar reuniones y talleres públicos sobre derechos de inquilines.
• Fuertes habilidades organizativas y de comunicación.
• Flexibilidad para trabajar algunas tardes y fines de semana.
• Se prefiere experiencia con informes de subvenciones de la ciudad de San Francisco

Este puesto es un puesto exento de tiempo completo con un salario actual de $66,560. Los beneficios incluyen aseguranza médica, dental y de vista, incluidos quiropráctica y acupuntura, y una generosa acumulación de vacaciones pagadas y tiempo de enfermedad. Este es un puesto en persona de 40 horas. El Comité de Vivienda es un lugar de trabajo solidario que se centra en el cuidado personal y colectivo para garantizar que todos estemos aquí a largo plazo.

Para postularse, envíe un currículum vitae y una carta de presentación a resume@hrcsf.org con  Consejere Líder Hispanohablante en la línea de asunto.

El Comité de Vivienda es un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades: ¡se anima a las personas de color, mujeres, inmigrantes, LGBTQI2S y personas con discapacidades a presentar su solicitud! Los diversos puntos de vista son vitales para la misión y la cultura de nuestra organización. De conformidad con la Ordenanza de Oportunidad Justa de San Francisco, consideraremos para empleo a solicitantes calificados con antecedentes de arresto y condena.

title: Instaladores de Chain Link/Fence Installer
description:

Debe poder instalar todo tipo de fence metal, chain link, madera, vinyl etc . También debe poder trabajar de forma independiente y con otros miembros del equipo. Mantenerse motivado durante todo el día es imprescindible.

title: Health & Wellness Coordinator for Adults w Developmental Disabilities
description:
Cedars of Marin (www.cedarslife.org) provides day programs and residential opportunities for adults with developmental disabilities. Cedars began in 1919, and for more than a century our person-centered programs and services have supported hundreds of clients in living creative, productive, joyous and healthy lives. 

As a vital member of the Health and Wellness team, the Coordinator will display caring, professionalism, excellent communication skills, sensitivity, and flexibility. You will accompany Cedars clients to medical appointments, maintain  medical data, and work closely with other staff to support the health and address the medical needs of our clients. This work is fun, creative, fulfilling, and challenging!

Essential Functions:
1. Maintain medical database and perform data entry.
2. Email health and behavior notes to the appropriate staff on weekly basis.
3. Prepare detailed files in advance of appointments.
4. Schedule appointments as required.
5. Transport residents to doctor and other healthcare appointments.
6. Respond to drop-in health concerns, injuries, illnesses, and emergencies.
7. Maintain cleanliness of the Health and Wellness offices and area.
8. Administer medication.
9. Triage phone calls concerning residents' medical concerns, and contact appropriate professionals.
10. Communicate with pharmacies and medical offices to ensure medication accuracy and documentation.
11. Communicate with family members, Cedars staff, and health care professionals.

General Qualifications: 
1. Experience in supporting adults with developmental disabilities is strongly desired.
2. Desire to help others achieve their full potential.
3. Medical background, skills, and terminology is a plus. 
4. Ability to think ahead and take initiative.
5. English communication skills, both written and verbal.
6. The ability to drive a passenger van. Clean DMV record and valid CA driver's license.
7. Proficient in the use of email and the ability to learn a database.
8. CPR and First Aid certifications or the willingness to acquire both.
9. Ability to pass an occupational employment physical including a TB test, and meet the physical requirements of the job.
10. Ability to pass a criminal background check with the FBI and DOJ.


Benefits for full-time (30+ hours/week), regular employees:
1. Medical, Dental, Vision
2. (403B) with matching of $.50 on the $1.00 on a tenure scale
3. Paid Vacation, Sick, 3 Personal Days and 10 paid Holidays
4. Flexible Spending Account Plan
5. Employee Assistance Program
6. Employer paid Life/ADD insurance policy
7. Employer paid Long Term Disability Insurance

To apply, please send your resume and cover letter and type "Health & Wellness Coordinator" in the subject line.

Diversity Statement:
The Cedars of Marin does not discriminate on the basis of disability status in the admission or access to, or treatment or employment in its federally assisted programs and activities. The person named below has been designated to coordinate compliance with the nondiscrimination requirements contained in the Department of Housing and Urban Development's regulations implementing Section 504 (24 CFR, part 8, dated 6/2/88. title: Scientist 2
description:
10x Genomics, Inc. in Pleasanton, CA seeks Scientist 2.

Responsibilities: The Scientist 2 will be a part of the Molecular Biology team working closely with scientists in the Assay Development team to create and optimize new and innovative single cell and spatial multi-omic products. More specific duties include: supporting method development and optimization of novel molecular biology assay schemes for single cell and spatial transcriptomic applications, including molecular barcoding, nucleic acid amplification, and next-generation sequencing (NGS) library preparation; supporting the optimization of sample storage methods such as tissue and cell fixation, decrosslinking or reversible fixation for compatibility with single cell and spatial multi-omic profiling applications; planning, performing, and evaluating data of biological experiments to support, improve, and expand our complex and proprietary technologies, products, and solutions; writing protocols, developing procedures, and maintaining accurate records of biological experiments and analyses; clearly communicating and presenting results of data and experiments for making critical design decisions; and other duties as assigned. Salary Range $130k - $150k.

Education: PhD in Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Cell Biology, or a related scientific field (or foreign equivalent).

Requirements: One (1) year of experience in the job offered or related research positions. Other special requirements: One (1) year of experience in NGS library preparation, principle of sequencing technologies, and data analysis; one (1) year of experience in standard molecular biology techniques such as sample preparation, nucleic acid amplification, qPCR, and DNA sequencing; one (1) year of experience in designing novel molecular biology assay schemes, and computational analysis of next-generation sequencing data; and one (1) year of experience in troubleshooting, method development, and assay optimization.

Qualified applicants must send resume to 10x Genomics, Attn: Jana Jensen, 6230 Stoneridge Mall Rd, Pleasanton, CA 94588 quoting job #S223.

title: Field Application Scientist
description:
10x Genomics, Inc. in Pleasanton, CA seeks Field Application Scientist.

Responsibilities: The Field Application Scientist will be engaging with customers daily and delivering system usage trainings at customer sites, while providing experimental design, data analysis, logistical, and troubleshooting support across your region.  Specific job duties include: troubleshooting issues related to user's technical skills, teaching the concepts of biochemistry assays, experimental design, software and instruments trainings; interpreting customer needs and identifying the proper issue escalation pathway within 10x; supporting field sales team at customer sites, trade shows, seminars and technical symposiums (including presentations and networking with thought leaders); scientifically partnering with customers as they develop their research utilizing 10x technologies; contributing to documentation with the goal of expanding support content; and other duties as assigned. Domestic and International Travel required up to 80% of the time. Employee may be stationed anywhere in continental U.S., reporting to 10x’s headquarters in Pleasanton, California. Salary Range $115k - $140k.

Education: Master’s degree in Cellular Biology, Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, Genetics or related field (or foreign equivalent).

Requirements: One (1) year of experience in the job offered or related research positions. Other special requirements: One (1) year of experience in single cell laboratory; one (1) year of experience in sorting cytometry and associated data analysis software; and one (1) year of hands-on experience in cell culture and molecular biology bench techniques. Domestic and International Travel required up to 80% of time.

Qualified applicants must send resume to 10x Genomics, Attn: Jana Jensen, 6230 Stoneridge Mall Rd, Pleasanton, CA 94588 quoting job #FAS23.

title: Microfluidics Engineer III
description:
10x Genomics, Inc. in Pleasanton, CA seeks Microfluidics Engineer III.

Responsibilities: The Micorfluidics Engineer III will collaborate closely with experts in Molecular Biology, Chemistry, Hardware, and/or Software to bring complex, fully integrated assays, consumables, and/or instruments to market. More specific duties include: prototyping, designing, and testing fluidics systems (equipment and consumables) for laboratory instrumentation; designing and building devices, planning and performing complex experiments, and generating high quality results to inform data-driven decisions; developing and testing microfluidic platform technologies for single cell and/or spatial genomics or multi-omic assays; planning and executing methodical, efficient experiments to ensure the robustness of microfluidic consumables used in 10x Genomics products; collaborating with cross-functional groups to conceive and assess feasibility of new solutions and driving down selection and de-rising of technical approaches; analyzing and identifying opportunities for continuous improvements in processes and products and developing and improving lab infrastructure and capabilities; effectively communicating results and findings within the Microfludics Group as well as other groups at 10x Genomics; and other duties as assigned. Salary Range $130k - $160k.

Education: PhD in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering or related field (or foreign equivalent).

Requirements: One (1) year of experience in the job offered or related positions. Other special requirements: One (1) year of experience in microscale mass transport phenomena, including convection, diffusion, reaction, and their coupled effects; one (1) year of experience in developing and prototyping microfluidic systems, including fluidic routing, flow generation mechanisms; one (1) year of experience in engineering particle manipulation methods (e.g., hydrodynamic, dielectrophoretic, acoustophoretic, optical); and one (1) year of experience in programming for data analysis and/or mass transport simulation or modeling.

Qualified applicants must send resume to 10x Genomics, Attn: Jana Jensen, 6230 Stoneridge Mall Rd, Pleasanton, CA 94588 quoting job #ME2023.

title: Facilities Manager
description:
Provide a safe & well-maintained environment for our clients, dogs, volunteers, visitors, and team.

At Guide Dogs for the Blind, we create exceptional partnerships between people, dogs, and communities. With a network of instructors, puppy raisers, donors, and volunteers, we prepare highly qualified guide dogs and K9 Buddy dogs, provide guide dog readiness skills, and offer youth programs to empower individuals who are blind or visually impaired. We are looking for a Facilities Manager at our San Rafael, CA campus, GDB’s National Headquarters, to oversee all aspects of campus infrastructure operations including fleet operations.

What you’ll love:
•	The ability to make an impact on our mission and provide a safe area for our clients, dogs, staff, volunteers and visitors 
•	The opportunity to create meaningful bonds with multiple departments across our organization and within our local communities
•	A satisfying variety of tasks that keeps every day interesting
•	A role that requires detail-oriented work that brings new challenges and exciting opportunities every day
•	The camaraderie of our incredible GDB team
•	You can bring your dog to work!

What you’ll do:
•	Manage maintenance and repair work of all critical infrastructure, equipment, fleet (50+ vehicles), and grounds in California and maintain preventative and predictive maintenance programs for the CA campus and remote fleet locations. Annual budgetary management responsibility of $5M.
•	Perform advanced electrical, mechanical, plumbing, and carpentry repairs as necessary
•	Manage the Facilities staff (6 full-time staff), including conducting job evaluations and measuring performance against goals and objectives, as well as hiring, training, and mentoring staff
•	Coordinate with the leadership team on long-term infrastructure planning and lead or assist with RFPs and management of capital projects
•	Oversee all aspects of security and coordinate safety needs with Safety Manager
•	Provide on-call support when after-hours emergencies or other issues arise outside of on-call staff’s expertise

The qualifications you’ll need:
•	5+ years of experience managing maintenance functions and supervising facilities personnel
•	Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
•	Understanding of and ability to train others in concepts and techniques related to plumbing, electrical, HVAC, architectural, and space planning design
•	Excellent organizational and project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and tasks concurrently, prioritize tasks, plan workflow, coordinate projects, and resolve conflicting demands
•	Experience maintaining large fleets of vehicles, including specialized and/or custom vehicles preferred
•	Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
•	Proficiency in MS Office required; Knowledge of E-Maint, HMI/HVAC, and AutoCAD software preferred
•	Valid driver’s license and satisfactory driving record 

Highlights of your rewards:
•	Health, dental, and vision insurance
•	Paid vacation, holidays, and sick leave
•	403(b) retirement savings plan with discretionary employer match 
•	Short-term and long-term disability
•	Life insurance and AD&D (100% employer-paid)
•	Flexible Spending Account for medical and dependent care expenses
•	Employee Assistance Program
•	Dog and cat food discounts
•	Employee Referral Program
•	Tuition reimbursement

Guide Dogs for the Blind
At Guide Dogs for the Blind (GDB), we believe that everyone deserves to move through the world safely and confidently – to live the life they want to live. As the largest guide dog school in North America, we have graduated more than 16,000 guide dog teams from across the U.S. and Canada since our founding in 1942. GDB not only improves mobility for our clients, we further inclusion. Join our team of more than 300 employees and share your passion for our mission.

Apply Now: https://app.jobvite.com/j?cj=ovPZqfwt&s=Craigslist 

At Guide Dogs for the Blind, we respect, value, and appreciate all differences. We welcome all qualified candidates irrespective of your race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, marital status, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. Individuals with disabilities, especially those who are blind or visually impaired, are encouraged to apply.  If you have a disability and need assistance and/or accommodation with applying for a job, please feel free to contact Human Resources.

Pay Range:
$106K - $125K

title: SCM Systems Specialist
description:
10x Genomics, Inc. in Pleasanton, CA seeks SCM Systems Specialist.

Responsibilities: The SCM Systems Specialist is responsible for supporting supply chain processes with focus on Order Management for ongoing projects and production support followed with enterprise applications Quality Control/Testing. Specific duties include: working with supply chain and finance teams to support process improvement projects through the identification, development, and implementation of new or improved solutions; running Enterprise Applications testing on Oracle Cloud and other peripheral systems to connect; understanding 10x processes and analyzing and translating needs across supply chain into new test script; executing functional test cases and test scripts and reporting and documenting the defects; performing regression testing using 10x specific test scripts and confirming that solutions and processes are not impacted; collaborating with Customer Service and fulfillment teams to define requirements and scope while acting as subject matter expert for some of the projects; reviewing Oracle cloud’s quarterly updates for changes and new feature functionalities; providing day-to-day support for Oracle Cloud user issues in various areas; identify issues and/or opportunities and recommending process, data, and/or system solutions and upgrades; developing, maintaining, and documenting current and new system process flows for reference; other duties as assigned. Salary Range $175k-$215k.

Education: *Master’s Degree in IT, Computer Science, Engineering, or closely related field (or foreign equivalent).

Requirements: *Two (2) years of experience in the job offered or related positions. Other special requirements: Two (2) years of experience developing Oracle Applications; two (2) years of experience developing systems requirements, design and prototype, and implement business solutions; and two (2) years of experience preparing unit test cases and perform testing.

* In lieu of a Master’s Degree and two years of experience, employer will accept candidates with a Bachelor’s Degree (or foreign equivalent) in the stated fields and five years of progressive post-baccalaureate experience in the job offered or related positions.

Qualified applicants must send resume to 10x Genomics, Attn: Jana Jensen, 6230 Stoneridge Mall Rd, Pleasanton, CA 94588 quoting job #SCM23.

title: PHS-SPCA Animal Care Technician
description:
Title: 			Animal Care Technician
FLSA Status: 	Full Time, Non-Exempt; Union
Salary: 		$21.22 - $23.00 per hour, depending on experience

Excellent Benefits Package Available

Who We Are: Peninsula Humane Society & SPCA (PHS/SPCA) is a local, private, non-profit charitable organization dedicated to animal welfare. It is our mission is to build healthy relationships between people and animals. PHS/SPCA is truly an open admission shelter, not only accepting many pet animals who might be refused at other shelters, but also taking care of injured and orphaned native wildlife from San Francisco through San Mateo and the northern half of Santa Clara County. Our work means 5,000 lives saved each year.  Our Animal Care team works behind-the-scenes to ensure the animals in our care have clean and safe living areas, around the clock. To learn more about us, visit www.phs-spca.org.

Who You Are: A firm believer in humane care and kind treatment of animals. You have a variety of animal handling experience everywhere from cats, dogs, hamsters and more. Comfortable with labor intensive animal husbandry work and enjoys working in a team environment.

Essential Responsibilities: Other duties may be assigned

•	Provide humane care for all animals in the Peninsula Humane Society's care
•	Clean and disinfect all animal areas as necessary to maintain a safe and sanitary environment 
•	Feed and ensure water are available at all times for all animals
•	Unload, store and restock Animal Care Department supplies 
•	Certified in Euthanasia within six months of employment (in house training)
•	Perform humane euthanasia in accordance with the Peninsula Humane Society policies and California laws as needed
•	Perform owner present euthanasia as needed 
•	Perform decapitations on select animals per the guidelines of the health department as needed
•	Perform proper disposal of deceased animals 
•	Perform light maintenance and other janitorial duties 
•	Assist in the training of new staff and volunteers 
•	Provide assistance to other departments as assigned 
•	Ensure a positive public image by enhancing the “behind the scenes” operation of the organization 
•	Work to help improve the quality of life for animals


Qualifications:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The individual must also possess the ability to manage the emotional aspect of end-of-life services and humane euthanasia, and support staff in high-emotion circumstances. 

•	Upon hire, must pass a background check. 
•	High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or six months to one year related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
•	Must be able to lift up to 50lbs from ground to waist
•	Must also possess the ability to manage the emotional aspect of end-of-life services and humane euthanasia, and support staff in high-emotion circumstances
•	Must have a flexible schedule and the ability to work on weekends, holidays, swing shift and graveyard shift as needed


Excellent Benefits Package Available
•	Medical /Dental /Vision/Life/ Flex Spending 
•	Sick, Vacation and Holiday pay 
•	Continued Education Opportunities/Reimbursement
•	Employee Assistance Plan
•	Retirement plan & employer matching 

Available to all employees with pets:
•	Free vaccines, spay/neuter, microchipping, and two pet adoptions 
•	Discounted euthanasia services/cremation, bloodwork, urinalysis, prescription food, and discounts at our retail stores. 


For more information about our available job opportunities and how to apply, please visit our website at www.peninsulahumanesociety.org/careers 



The Peninsula Humane Society & SPCA is an equal opportunity employer.  We consider applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status.  EOE/M/F/D/V/SO

title: PHS-SPCA Wildlife Satellite Intake & Transport Coordinator
description:
Job Title:		Wildlife Satellite Intake & Transport Coordinator	
FLSA Status:		Non-Exempt/Non-Union/Full-Time
Salary:		$24 - $27 per hour, depending on experience
		 
Excellent Benefits Package Available
This position is on-site in Saratoga and travels to our Burlingame and San Jose worksites for training.


Who we are:  The Peninsula Humane Society & SPCA (PHS/SPCA) is a local, private, non-profit charitable organization dedicated to animal welfare. It is our mission is to build healthy relationships between people and animals. PHS/SPCA is truly an open admission shelter, not only accepting many pet animals who might be refused at other shelters, but also taking care of injured and orphaned native wildlife. We’re among just a handful of humane societies and SPCAs, worldwide, that extends its caring services to sick, injured and orphaned wildlife. Typically, we successfully rehabilitate 1,200 to 1,400 animals each year, vital work made possible by generous donations. To learn more about us, visit www.phs-spca.org.

Who you are:    You have a passion for rehabilitating a variety of wildlife animals by providing daily leadership, and direction, with hands on support to the Transport Team and for each of the satellite intake locations. You oversee daily operations consistent with the organization’s policies and procedures.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities: 

•	Delegates and supervises the daily tasks of Wildlife Transport Specialists. 
•	Oversees transport schedule and ensures wildlife is being transported to Conservation Center in a timely and efficient manner.
•	Communicates routinely and effectively with key personnel at each partner pick-up agency to ensure optimal working relationship between organizations.
•	Ensures transport vehicles are maintained in a clean and orderly manner and stocked with the necessary equipment. 
•	Reports damage to vehicle or equipment. Ensures routine maintenance is performed according to manufacturer’s recommended schedule. 
•	Oversees and participates in the training of new transport and satellite location staff. 
•	Monitors both satellite locations to ensure all necessary supplies are stocked and equipment is functional to support smooth and timely animal intake and transport activities.
•	Monitors both satellite locations to ensure triage, animal care and transfer policies are followed. Works with Wildlife Rehabilitation Manager to address any deficiencies. 
•	Communicate professionally and effectively with coworkers, volunteers, and representatives from other organizations. 
•	Participates in regular staff meetings. Leads discussion on satellite locations and animal transport program. 
•	Serves as the primary point of contact for coordinating animal releases. Assists with wildlife releases as needed. 
•	Performs animal transport functions as needed. 
•	Covers staffing needs at satellite locations as needed. 
•	Performs euthanasia in accordance with PHS/SPCA policies and state and federal laws. Performs decapitations when required for county health department. 
•	Proposes and implements operational efficiency and safety improvement. 
•	Provides assistance to other departments as assigned. Performs other duties as assigned to ensure a positive public image, enhance the operation of the organization, and improve the quality of life for animals.



Supervisory Responsibilities
Directly supervises Wildlife Transport Specialists and the Satellite Wildlife Rehabilitation teams. Ensures animal transport is timely and efficient. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization’s policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; addressing complaints and resolving problems.
 
Qualifications
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 

•	Upon hire, must pass a background check.

•	Able to multitask and work efficiently and calmly under stressful circumstances.

•	Must be able to work well in a team environment and have a professional demeanor. 

•	Must have a flexible schedule and the ability to work on weekends and/or holidays as needed.

•	High School Diploma or equivalent is required. Degree from an accredited college with an emphasis in Business and Wildlife Management is preferred, or equivalent combination of education and experience. At least two years of supervisory experience is required.

•	Valid California Driver’s License with clean driving record to be insured with PHS insurance. 

•	Certified in euthanasia within 6 months of employment.

•	Must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50-75 pounds.  

•	Basic knowledge or become proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and computer keyboarding skills, and data entry is required.

•	Must be able to reliably commute to San Jose and Burlingame.



Excellent Benefits Package Available
•	Medical /Dental /Vision/Life/ Flex Spending
•	Sick, Vacation and Holiday pay
•	Employee Assistance Plan
•	Retirement plan & employer matching

Available to all employees with pets:
•	Free vaccines, spay/neuter, microchipping, and two pet adoptions
•	Discounted euthanasia services/cremation, bloodwork, urinalysis, prescription food, and discounts at our retail stores.

For more information about our available job opportunities and how to apply, please visit our website at www.phs-spca.org/careers


The Peninsula Humane Society & SPCA is an equal opportunity employer. We consider applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, marital or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other legally protected status. EOE/M/F/D/V/SO

title: PHS-SPCA Human Resources Assistant
description:
Job Title: 		Human Resources Assistant 
FLSA Status: 	Non-Exempt/ Full Time
Salary:		$21.22 - $23.25/hour (depending on experience)

Excellent Benefits Package Available
Weekends and holidays off!

Who we are:  Peninsula Humane Society & SPCA (PHS/SPCA) is a local, private, non-profit charitable organization dedicated to animal welfare. It is our mission is to build healthy relationships between people and animals. PHS/SPCA is truly an open admission shelter, not only accepting many pet animals who might be refused at other shelters, but also taking care of injured and orphaned native wildlife from San Francisco through San Mateo and the northern half of Santa Clara County. Our work means 5,000 lives saved each year.  Our HR team supports over 100 employees in multiple nearby locations. To learn more about us, visit www.phs-spca.org. 

Who you are: Someone that truly believes in animal welfare and ethical animal rehabilitation. You have emotional intelligence in difficult situations, are detail orientated, and can stay well organized. Ready to aid the HR department in serving our employees and contributing to a positive work environment. You stay up to date with all federal, state, and local legal requirements pertinent to HR.
              			

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Recruitment: 
•	Post and maintain all open positions on job boards.
•	Review all applicant resumes and phone screen qualified candidates.
•	Respond to all job inquiries from our website, emails, and phone calls.
•	Introduce the qualified candidates to the HR Director and/or hiring department managers to proceed to the next steps in the recruitment process.
•	Maintain detailed recruitment status reports in the applicant tracking system.
•	Organize and maintain recruitment notes from hiring managers.
•	Coordinate administration and recruitment efforts for the RVT internship program and serve as the point of contact for the vet schools.
•	Assist with the review, and updates of the organizations job descriptions and job postings.
•	Attend job fairs both virtually and in person.
•	Other recruiting related functions may be assigned.

New Hire Process and Onboarding:
•	Prepare new hire packets and onboarding materials.
•	Call references and run background checks.
•	Coordinate and facilitate onboarding meetings. Facilitates on boarding meetings for sister organization new hires.
•	Assist in the preparation of materials used in new employee orientation and staff trainings.
•	Schedules and facilitates new employee check-ins (90 and 180-day reviews) for PHS and sister orgs. Alert HR Director of any trends or immediate concerns.
•	Responsible for maintaining new hire checklists and required documents for PHS and sister orgs.
•	Conduct exit interviews for terminating employees at PHS and sister orgs.


Safety:
•	Assist the HR Coordinator with the research and execution of the safety programs, initiatives and trainings in an effort to maintain a company-wide workplace environment free of incidents and accidents.
o	Member of safety committee
o	Assist with training new safety committee members on building safety inspections.
o	Assist with workers compensation claims and tracking.
•	Assist with annual IIPP updates.

Additional Responsibilities:
•	Prepare, summarize and edit bi-weekly employee attendance reports for each department.
•	Record and track various employee relations programs, rewards and recognition programs.
•	Prepare termination packets and COBRA documents for exiting employees.
•	Assist in ensuring compliance with all federal, state and local legal requirements by understanding existing and new legislation.
•	Assist with troubleshooting/researching to resolve various HR related topics or problems as they arise.
•	Assist in organizing and implementing employee relation events, activities, reward and recognition programs.
•	Assist with the employee data maintenance of the ADP HRIS 
•	Maintain employee files electronically via Dropbox.
•	Perform other general administrative duties as assigned.
•	Encourage and promote a positive public image of the organization.

Qualifications:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily with high attention to detail and accuracy ensuring deadlines are met and accurate records are kept. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

•	Upon hire, must pass background check.
•	Ability to work effectively under pressure, handle multiple projects and adapt to changing priorities to deliver efficient and accurate results in a fast-paced HR environment.
•	Ability to work professionally in person and over the phone with volunteers, fellow co-workers, management, candidate applicants and members of the public.
•	Ability to handle confidential information and records with the utmost of discretion. 
•	Ability to work independently, possess strong organizational and time management skills, and good problem-solving skills. 
•	Strong attention to detail.
•	Bachelor’s Degree (BA) or Associate’s Degree (AA); At least 6 months HR experience and/or training. 
•	HR Certifications are a plus.
•	Basic working knowledge of HRIS systems such ADP Workforce Now, Microsoft Office Suite (MS Word, MS Excel, MS Outlook, etc.) and computer keyboarding and data entry skills. Basic experience with Dropbox database. Basic experience with video conferencing systems.


Excellent Benefits Package Available
•	Medical /Dental /Vision/Life/ Flex Spending 
•	Sick, Vacation and Holiday pay 
•	Continued Education Opportunities/Reimbursement
•	Employee Assistance Plan
•	Retirement plan & employer matching 

Available to all employees with pets:
•	Free vaccines, spay/neuter, microchipping, and two pet adoptions 
•	Discounted euthanasia services/cremation, bloodwork, urinalysis, prescription food, and discounts at our retail stores.

title: Registered Dental Hygienist (RDH) 2-3 days per week w/ benefits
description:
Our office is looking for a kind, compassionate, efficient, cooperative, patient, self-motivated Registered Dental Hygienist to work 2 days per week, Thursday, and Fridays, with the option of picking up Wednesdays.

We are a well-established and highly respected dental practice in San Pablo, in the heart of West Contra Costa County in the East Bay. We have a loyal patient base of patients who come regularly from San Pablo, Richmond, Pinole, El Cerrito, Berkeley, Oakland, even as far as Sacramento, San Francisco, and San Jose.

We have an experienced staff that works well together, several of whom have been with the practice for more than 10 and 15 years and some for than 5. We want to find a hygienist who can communicate well and work as an efficient member of a team.

You will work on Thursdays and Fridays. On Thursdays, we work from 8am-5pm, and you will see 7 patients, an hour each with a 1.5 hour lunch. Fridays are our early start, early finish days: we work from 7am-2pm, and you would see 6 patients, also an hour each with a half hour lunch. If you would like extra work, you could request an additional Wednesday, with advanced notice (same schedule as Thursdays).

You will primarily help provide care for preventative visits, such as prophies and perio maintenance. You may occasionally do one to two quadrants of root planing. You are responsible for taking your own check-up x-rays and turning over your own room, and we do the exam in your chair. We see new patients separate from their hygiene visits, not in the same hour in a hygiene chair.

Our pay is competitive for the surrounding West Contra Costa County area and will be discussed. In addition, we provide generous benefits, even for part-time employees, such as health insurance, dental, 401(k), holiday pay, vacation time, license renewals, time off for CE, well days, and bonuses, scaled to the number of days worked. Full time is considered 4 days per week, so if you work 2 days per week, your benefits would be scaled to 50% of full-time. Spanish speaking is a plus but not necessary and would be taken into consideration. Both new grads and experienced hygienists are welcome to apply.

We would start with up to a 90 day introductory period to see if our practice is a good fit for you and if you are a good fit for our practice. Please reach out with a resume and we will contact you as soon as possible to talk on the phone and then meet in person. Must have current license and BLS.

title: Hiring Warehouse Operations Manager
description:
SOUL FOCUS SPORTS
Soul Focus Sports is a multi-faceted sports management and experience marketing company. We produce events that create community through the power of human movement. Born out of the world of running and endurance sports, Soul Focus ideates, creates, owns, and manages all types of sporting events nationwide. See www.soulfocussports.com for more information. 

Job Title: Warehouse Operations Manager

Job Description:
Soul Focus Sports is seeking a highly organized, experienced, and responsible individual to join our team as the Warehouse Operations Manager. In this role, you will be responsible for overseeing warehouse operations, managing inventory, coordinating shipments, and implementing specific procedures for the greater warehouse operations team. 

This is a full-time role based in our Soquel, CA warehouse (5 days a week with occasional weekend event work).

Responsibilities:

*Warehouse Operations:
-Manage all aspects of warehouse operations, including shipping, receiving, storing and organizing.
-Manage a staff of 1 full-time employee, and several part-time employees.
-Develop and implement efficient procedures to optimize processes and minimize errors.
-Maintain accurate inventory records through regular counts and audits for all proprietary and client assets.
-Coordinate with internal and external client account managers to ensure accurate and timely inventory, shipments and transit logs.
-Track all shipments with an online inventory management system.
-Oversee, manage and provide support/guidance to warehouse personnel in an effort to improve efficiencies of overall warehouse processes.
-Attend numerous meetings per week with the warehouse operations executive team.
-Attend all relevant internal/external meetings and calls.

*Event-Related Work:
-Coordinate the preparation of outbound shipments and the receiving and check-in of inbound shipments for 50+ events yearly.
-Work with Soul Focus client account managers to create and fulfill pack lists for events, shipments, and auxiliary needs.
-Work agreed upon weekend events (may require overnight/travel).

*Equipment and Facility Maintenance:
-Responsible for the warehouse to the highest standard of organization and cleanliness.
-Ensure warehouse equipment is well-maintained and in safe working condition.
-Ensure warehouse supplies are well-stocked and ordered timely to meet workload.
-Coordinate repairs, maintenance, and servicing of equipment and infrastructure.
-Collaborate with relevant departments to address facility maintenance needs promptly.

*Qualifications:
-High school diploma or equivalent; college degree preferred; additional certifications or training in warehouse operations is a plus.
-Proven experience in warehouse operations, inventory management, or related fields.
-Knowledge of inventory software, procedures, and best practices.
-Knowledge and proficiency in Microsoft Office suite of applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.) and Google Suite of apps (Docs, Sheets, etc.)
-Excellent organizational and time management skills.
-Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
-Ability to lift up to 50 pounds and operate warehouse equipment such as pallet jacks and forklifts
-Licensed to use and past experience with equipment such as forklift and pallet jack preferred. 

*Compensation:
-Competitive salary based on experience ($65,000 - $85,000)
-Medical and Dental Insurance
-401(k)
-Paid Time Off

*Hiring Timeline
- Deadline to apply for the position is Tuesday, January 23.
- Expected start date is February 1st, 2024.

title: Counter Server - Barista at Flour Craft Bakery- MV
description:
Our passion is to create wholesome, flavorful food using exceptional quality ingredients. We hand craft all of our baked goods in our dedicated gluten-free environment. We hope you taste the love and care that goes into each product we create

Flour Craft Bakery is looking for a friendly, energetic, responsible individual to join our front of house team. We are looking for a part-time team member that is able to work both weekend days. We are a locally owned, artisan bakery & cafe, featuring thoughtfully made pastries, breads, and healthy fare. We are a family owned business with two retail locations in Marin County.We love to feed people and are passionate about providing healthy, nourishing food for our community.Job qualifications:-You should be at least 18-years old with previous barista and/or server experience.-You should be responsible, reliable & outgoing. -You should have a positive attitude and be passionate about food, coffee, and service.-You should have a strong work ethic.-You should be a team player, and able to step in to lend a hand wherever and whenever necessary.-You must have a valid CA Food Handlers Card (or will be asked to obtain one within 30 days of hiring).-You must be available on both weekend days.Why work at Flour Craft?We offer a positive & respectful work environment as part of a close-knit team.We offer competitive base wage plus great tips, totaling $22-24/hr.We offer a generous employee discount & staff meal program.We offer medical benefits, paid vacation, PTO, and matching 401K plan for those that qualify.We offer a livable work schedule; no late nights or crazy early mornings.Currently a part-time position is available. You should be available both mornings and afternoons, and on weekends. We are open 8am-4pm and shifts run 7a-3p, 8a-4p, 830a-430p.Locations:Flour Craft Mill Valley, 129 Miller Ave #300, in the historic Mill Valley Lumber Yard & 702 San Anselmo Ave in downtown San Anselmo.Both locations are nearby a bus stop and have ample bicycle and car parking.Please reply with your resume as well as your CV & references. We are an equal opportunity employer.




Click To Apply!!

title: Chief Financial Officer
description:
Delivering Innovation in Supportive Housing (DISH) has been a trailblazer in the supportive housing sector in San Francisco since 2006. Committed to providing high quality, permanent supportive housing for residents who suffer serious health issues, DISH stands as a unique organization dedicated to creating positive change in our community. 

We are on the lookout for a visionary individual to become our first Chief Financial Officer.  DISH began operations with a fiscal sponsor, and are now transitioning to an independent 501c3. We’re not just looking for an experienced CFO; we’re seeking someone with a heart for the underserved communities and ready to lead the charge in revolutionizing financial practices in the non-profit sector.

The ideal candidate will:
•	Be an executive with the skills to create a new finance department in the non-profit landscape
•	Embody leadership qualities that foster a culture of respect, dignity and love for one another including our resident community
•	Understand the profound connection between homelessness  and  systemic racism, and be dedicated  to eliminating barriers thereby promoting healing in our community 
•	An individual passionate to positively impact the society we live in

What you will work with:
•	A dedicated leadership team that practices simple kindness, fair and equitable treatment of staff and residents
•	An annual budget of $15 million with four  government contracts and growing private support
•	Nine properties that provide supportive housing for approximately 800 formerly unhoused residents
•	Currently 94 employees 
•	Partnerships with San Francisco Department of Homelessness and Supportive Housing (HSH), primary funder and services partnerships with Episcopal Community Services (ECS), UCSF Citywide, and Compass Family Services
•	The opportunity to be a leader in the transition of DISH into an independent 501(c)(3) organization

Next step – review the full job description at https://dishsf.org/jobs/
Then - Email resume and contact information: 
Subject line: “I read the full DISH CFO job description online”

title: Door Machine Operator/Millwork
description:
DOOR MACHINE OPERATOR

Job Summary

Job Title: Door Machine Operator
Job Brief: The Door Machine Operator's primary function is to machine interior doors on a Norfield door machine.
Job Starting Location: San Jose, CA 95112
Position Type: Full Time. Must be flexible to work over 40 hours when needed.Job Shift: Monday - Friday Flexible (Day Shift)
Compensation: Competitive hourly rate (starting at $25/hour) plus benefits
Supervisory Responsibilities: None
 
Job Description
 
Pacific Doorcraft is seeking a highly motivated team player to help with our continued growth. The Door Machine Operator is an important piece of PacDoor’s reputation for fair pricing, top of the line products, and quality service. The principal purpose of this role is to machine interior doors on a Norfield door machine.  At PacDoor, we value team members that are reliable. Our customers  expect us to deliver on our commitments, whether it is next day delivery of their order, or exceptional carpentry solutions. Every team member is an integral part of who we are and what we do!

Essential Job Duties
 
Duties/Responsibilities
• Pull doors, jambs, and hinges based on work orders
• Maintain proper inventory for door production
• Organize doors in efficient production order
• Set up machine properly for handing, bore, mortise and other hardware
• Maintain a clean and orderly work environment
• Heavy lifting is required
• Perform other duties as needed by the Shop Foreman


Job Requirements
 
Preferred Qualifications
* You must have a full understanding of tape measures, carpentry basics, and common sense in a woodshop
* Previous industry experience (3+ years)

Education and Experience
* You must be 18 years or older
* Ability to read and evaluate work orders
* Outstanding customer and colleague relationship skills
* Energetic, competitive attitude
* Strong work ethic, constant attention to detail, and a commitment to reliability
* Take pride in your work
* Reliable transportation to/from work

Physical Requirements
* Be comfortable working on your feet for the duration of your shift
* Good eyesight with corrective lenses
* Stoop, kneel, and crouch
* Use hands and arms to reach for, handle, and manipulate objects
* Able to safely lift 50 pounds safely and 80-100+ pounds with helper

Benefits
 
PacDoor offers the following company benefits:
• Eligibility for health, vision, dental coverage subject to plan terms.
• Eligibility for 401(k) plan subject to plan terms.
• Eligibility for company-paid benefits such as long-term disability, subject to applicable waiting periods.
• Paid time off (PTO) earned on an accrual basis.
• Company-paid holidays

title: Auto Technicians Come Fix Cars In a Good Team Environment
description:
We're a super busy 4-man 3-lift shop with room to expand in Sebastopol looking to hire another "A" or 'B' level technician. We're simple folks growing a small business, a father & son team, with two additional hands supporting our engine building and shop duties. We provide tools, lifts, kits and top of the line diagnostic and computers, have climate control, work Monday-Friday and work on local Subaru, Honda, Toyota, Acura, Lexus, Ford, Dodge, Mitsubishi, Mini, Mazda, BMW, Audi, Volvo, Jaguar, Porsche cars from 1965 to 2021. We do not work on Hyundai or KIA. We are fleet service providers to several small businesses and State of California agencies. We focus on service, sincerity and hard science in our work. 

If you're interested in working in a space where understanding systems is encouraged and supported, no one yells, and original mistakes are a sign of growth, you'll enjoy working here.

Requirements:
3 years of CURRENT dealership or independent auto repair experience
* Ability to work 40 hour weeks
* Current CDL and ability to safely operate standard transmission vehicles
* Ability to operate computers, web browsers, tablets, cameras, Autel scan tools, multimeter, picoscope/oscope a plus
* Consistent behavior, communication and able to demonstrate continual trustworthiness to customers and team members
* Ability to demonstrate work experience commensurate to the position, pass an in person interview and a willingness to shadow our team in the shop for a day after an interview

Compensation:
+ 40 hour work weeks at a billable rate
+ Fixed monthly bonus based on meeting basic efficiency goals (total number of invoiced hours) or benefits, or a housing stipend as an option depending on the candidate and mutual fit
+ Flexible scheduling week to week, as a father/son team we get work life balance 

We have plenty of tablets, laptops and computers to share, use ShopMonkey CRM, AllData, Mitchel1, and we have 7 part deliveries a day from Worldpac, SSF Parts, local dealers and partners.

** People we are serious about 3 years of current experience as an auto technician.
*** No mobile mechanics. It isn't the same thing.
**** No industrial mechanics. It isn't the same thing.
***** Please no more, "I took auto classes 20 years ago" mechanics.
****** Please no more tough guy "I ain't got no resume, but I can fix your car" mechanics.

You can see your basic website (although most of the pictures are from our last, smaller shop)

http://www.the-neighbors-kid.com

See our business profile available on Google or Google Maps

title: Subpar Mini Golf Alameda Kitchen Staff $20+/hr with benefits
description:
Subpar Miniature Golf Alameda is currently hiring one kitchen staff to join the Ace Mulligan’s crew!

Subpar Miniature Golf Alameda serves food and drinks at our snack bar (Ace Mulligan's) to our favorite mini golfers, arcade players, competitors, teammates, families, friends, parties and events! 

Subpar is a fun and positive environment. We staff our kitchen with 1-2 people every day (more on weekends and busy shifts). The selected candidate would work 20-30 hours a week across 4-5 shifts.

Experience in kitchens is preferred, but not required. We are looking for someone who is open to learning, comfortable with responsibilities, able to prioritize and thrives in fast-paced environments. We value enthusiasm, initiative and positive energy.

WHO WE ARE
One of two best handmade indoor mini golf courses in the Bay Area (our other location is in San Francisco)! Our goal is to provide a lot of fun, and a little competitive action with our East Bay themed mini golf course and arcade.

RESPONSIBILITIES
The Kitchen Staff role is expected to operate the register with customer orders, prepare food and drink orders, deliver food and drink orders to customers, support course attendants with parties/events with food and drink orders, bus and clean tables, kitchen prep, clean and sanitize kitchen and service areas, track and maintain inventory, and additional tasks as offerings and services expand. Everyone pitches in when and where needed.

SHIFTS
20-30 hours a week across 4-5 shifts

PAY
Starting pay is at $20/hour. Pay commensurate with experience.

TIPS
Kitchen Staff receives a percentage of total tips on shifts 

INSURANCE
We offer health, dental and vision insurance coverage for employees working 4+ shifts per week, after 2 months of employment.

BENEFITS
2 weeks of paid personal leave per year
2 weeks of paid sick leave per year
Staff discount on food, non-alcoholic beverages and merchandise
Free mini golf and arcade play when off shift 
Discount on golf for your friends & family
Free beverage during your shift, or alcoholic drink at the end of your shift (21+ only)
Staff uniform provided (team t-shirts and sweatshirt)

QUALIFICATIONS
Kitchen experience preferred but not required 
Food handling certification (we will cover the certification fees if you're not yet certified)
Works well with others 
Comfortable giving and receiving constructive feedback
Collaborative 
Team player 
Proactive 
Strong communication skills 
Excited to learn and grow 
Track record of strong attendance
Punctual
Detail-oriented
Self-motivated
Dependable 
Flexible
Hardworking
Able to lift 40 pounds

HOW TO APPLY
To apply, please click reply to send us your resume and request a link to our online application form. From your online application, we’ll be reaching out to candidates that we’d like to interview.

Subpar Miniature Golf requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, and applicants are required to submit proof of vaccination prior to beginning employment.

title: CNA/LVN/RT for At-Home Caregiving Position
description:
I am looking for qualified new caregivers to add to my team! This is a great  opportunity for a reliable, flexible, and motivated caregiver or medical professional to use their skills in a home healthcare setting. 

I need people that will be available to work afternoon/evening shifts and/or overnight shifts.  I require 24/7 care so flexibility is important to help cover if other staff are unexpectedly out due to illness.  Please send your regular schedule availability so we see how you could fit into the schedule. 

ABOUT ME:
I'm a 37 year old tech and computer enthusiast with a Computer Engineering degree from UC Berkeley. I live near downtown Berkeley with my partner and dog. I have Muscular Dystrophy which makes my muscles very weak. I use a power wheelchair, ventilator and feeding tube. I mostly communicate by eye-tracking on a computer, and my caregivers do some lip reading.

JOB DUTIES:
While the job involves using some medical equipment, it mostly involves general caregiver tasks to allow me to comfortably and safely live my life. Tasks include positioning, range of motion exercises, personal care, transferring me into bed, giving medications, and other tasks as needed. I also have a tracheostomy for breathing, which means I cannot speak and am ventilator-dependent. While I mostly communicate with an eye tracking computer, you will also be taught to lip read my regular words.

Extensive training is provided until we both feel comfortable and competent in your ability to perform all parts of the job independently. 

I need a highly responsible and attentive caregiver who quickly responds to my medical and care needs, once trained. 

REQUIREMENTS:
–Experience with physical disabilities. Respiratory, ventilator and tracheostomy care highly desirable
–Ability to lift at least 30 pounds (for positioning me)
–Fluent English
–Must commit to working at least one year, as paid training is a significant investment
–Solid references from former employers; I will run a background check
–Lip-reading experience preferred
–Job requires some reaching, so if you're shorter than 5'4", some tasks may be physically difficult
–Valid drivers license preferred, but not required
–Can reliably commit to a consistent schedule
–Willingness and flexibility to back up shifts when other caregivers are out
–Live within a reasonable commute from Berkeley

SCHEDULE: 
We will work with you to determine your training and permanent schedule, depending on your availability, interest, and skills.

$30- $35/hr depending on relevant experience and credentials. I pay overtime, sick pay, bonuses, and give periodic raises. I also provide snacks on shift.

LOCATION: 
I live 3 blocks from the Downtown Berkeley BART in my own home with my partner and dog. Free off-street parking is available.

HOW TO APPLY: 
Click on the link to fill out the online application (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1MuOAr8ytZo4Nwp1dMgpyup2AIHJZnN7AQi8Ju5B3M8I/viewform).

If you have problems with the application, please email me through Craigslist‬. Please include: a description of your related work experience and qualifications, your resume, why you're interested in the job, your location, and availability. I require references.

title: Facilities Maintenance Technician
description:
Pivotal is the leader in the emerging market of electric Vertical Takeoff and Landing (eVTOL) aircraft. We design, develop, and manufacture light eVTOL aircraft and are renowned for the BlackFly, the first light eVTOL to fly manned missions and enter the consumer market.

Efficient, compact, and simple, Pivotal vehicles are designed for a wide range of consumer, public service, and defense applications. Our distinctive tilt-aircraft architecture and scalable platform have been in development, preparing to enter the market for over 10 years. We recently announced our next-generation aircraft, the Helix, planned for general release and scalable production in January 2024.

Mobility is one of the most highly-valued areas of technology investment today. This is the right company, in the right space, the right strategy, at the right time. We invite you to join our amazing team and grow with us.

Responsibilities
Knowledge and experience with general facility maintenance tasks
Relatable/transferable skills from other industries to be considered
Maintain a safe, well-organized and well-stocked work environment
Perform routine facility system inspections and assist in facility maintenance tasks
Build desks and other office and lab furniture
Perform weekly inventory counts on facility supplies, snacks, drinks and office supplies
Manage min/max stocking counts
Ensure break rooms, first aid boxes and office supply cabinets are kept stocked
Be an active team member of the Emergency Response, EH&S, and Security Awareness teams
Assist the receiving team when deliveries require additional support
Interact and escort vendors for onsite service calls/repairs
Active participant in existing or new processes that keep the office efficient
Occasional after-hours and weekend evolutions
Be a champion of Pivotal’s distinctive company culture

Qualifications
2+ years in a hands-on maintenance role
Keen judgment, ability to make sound independent decisions and know when to escalate
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact at all levels of the organization
Ability to multitask and reprioritize work orders, using best judgment
Proven ability to notice the small thing and demonstrate an attention to detail
Exceptional organization, planning, time management, and problem-solving skills
Must have demonstrable critical thinking skills
Must be able to lift 40 lbs, safely
Highly collaborative and team oriented
High level of proficiency with a variety of hand tools
High school diploma

Applicants must be eligible for employment in the United States and willing to work onsite at our HQ office in Palo Alto, CA.

Pivotal offers a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, and 401k plans.

Pivotal is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Pivotal does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.
