title: Hiring: Listing Project Manager- Top SF Real Estate Team
description:
We’re looking for a growth-minded Listing Project Manager in San Francisco, CA, to support a team of established, top-producing residential real estate agents. This is a partially remote opportunity where you can expect to work in the office two or three days per week, and you will be spending time out of the office meeting with vendors and managing listings. 

You’ll be the steady hand that provides excellent service to the agents and their growing client base. This team is looking for a long-term team player who shares their values of fairness, high integrity, and collaboration. If you have been looking for an environment and a career where your contributions are impactful, keep reading! 

Your Future Employer 

The Krishnan Team was founded in 2009 by Ruth Krishnan and ranks among the top 2 teams in San Francisco. The team sold over $140M in 2023. Part of what keeps them at the top of their game is their commitment to a culture of self-improvement. As a result, they are constantly learning and have created a fun and inclusive atmosphere. In addition, the team contributes 5% of its revenue to organizations within the community.

We Know You

You are also the ultimate team player, a collaborator, and a master at executing initiatives. You can work under limited supervision and take initiative with every piece of your role. You take charge, have a strong sense of urgency, and aren’t the type of person to shy away from a challenge. 

In the past, you have streamlined existing systems to ensure a company’s efficiency. Providing 5-star customer service comes naturally to you, and you enjoy picking up the phone to communicate effectively. You can catch the smallest of errors and know how to prioritize. While addressing problems, you’re able to maintain your upbeat attitude to keep a transaction running smoothly.

You are comfortable with a fast-paced environment, evolving responsibilities, and wearing multiple hats. Overall, you enjoy being a team player and recognize that there is no task too large or small that you are not willing to tackle! You are confident that your strength in project management will allow you to jump into this new role and hit the ground running.

The Opportunity

As a Listing Project Manager, you will be responsible for supporting our Listing Agents in preparing the properties for the market. This includes staying on top of voicemails and emails; quick responsiveness is imperative! 

You will create listing agreements, prepare disclosures, and order reports. In addition to scheduling, coordinating, and meeting with vendors at the listings, you will also run errands related to listings, drop off supplies, and ensure properties are ready for showings. Processing offers and obtaining signatures go hand-in-hand with serving as a point of contact for sellers, escrow agents, and buyer agents. 

You will provide support to team members at Open Houses and Showings as needed and support the Listing Agents with any listing activities. This includes attending Compass Sales Meetings and Krishnan Team Meetings. Exercise your creativity by keeping online listings up-to-date and coordinating with marketing professionals to market listings. 

Requirements

Your Experience and Qualifications

- You have 2+ years of experience in project management and customer service OR 2+ years of experience supporting other sales professionals in an administrative capacity. Experience in supporting others in real estate is a bonus. 
- A California Real Estate License is preferred, or you are willing to obtain one after hire. 
- B.A./B.S. Degree or equivalent experience 

Ideally, you are familiar with or can quickly learn… 

- Google Suite of Services, Dropbox, and DocuSign 
- CRM’s (i.e Salesforce)
- MLS

Salary: $80k-$100k (including bonuses), commensurate with qualifications and experience. Exceptional candidates with extensive expertise and a proven track record may be considered for a higher compensation package.

Benefits: Paid Time Off and Medical Benefits 

Hours: Hybrid – Remote/On-site 2 days a week. Full-time 40+ hours, 9 – 6, flexibility in the evenings and weekends required depending on the needs of the business. You must have a dedicated workspace free from distractions. 

Location: San Francisco, CA. You must live within a 30-minute commute of San Francisco, CA (southwest region – or willing to relocate) and MUST have daily access to a vehicle, a valid driver’s license, and carry insurance. 

**We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

TO APPLY- Reach out to hiring@ruthkrishnan.com

title: Reception Administrative Assistant – Wealth Management Firm
description:
*Please submit a resume and cover letter via email; resumes must have cover letters to be reviewed.

About the Job
A small, fast-growing financial planning firm is seeking an administrative assistant to represent us as the first point of contact. The ideal candidate is bright, friendly, energetic, ethical, has high integrity, is hard-working, proactive, and takes a challenge head-on. Must be organized, possess strong attention to detail, work independently, solve problems, be comfortable on the phone, have a high emotional IQ, and overall, be a well-rounded, warm individual. This position is vital in setting the practice's tone, ensuring clients and prospects have a positive experience, and maintaining our exceptional relationship-building culture.
 
Who We Are
We are a service-oriented financial consulting firm providing services ranging from investments to insurance and retirement services. We are passionate about our core values: Kindness, Engagement, Positivity, Trustworthiness, and Results-Driven. Our office culture is friendly and relaxed without sacrificing the quality of our results. We value independence and maintain the highest professional standards as an independent financial firm. Providing the best client experience begins with happy employees. 
 
About You
•	You have excellent attention to detail.
•	You have a professional demeanor and appearance.
•	You are passionately committed to serving and caring for other people.
•	You want to be here and make an impact. 
•	You are a quick learner and enjoy learning/working with software and technology.
•	You can handle multiple projects simultaneously and operate successfully under deadlines.
•	You possess superb soft skills: collaborative, proactive, approachable, and desire to learn and grow.
•	You are reliable and punctual, taking pride in owning your responsibilities and contributing to the team.
•	You are a professional with excellent written and verbal communication via phone, email, in-person, etc. 
•	You have strong organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills and proofreading and editing abilities.
•	You can follow directions while knowing when to take and run with the ball. 
•	Must be highly internet-savvy and proficient in MS Word, Excel, SalesForce, Outlook, and general computer skills.
•	You have 2+ years of administrative experience. 

In your role, you'll…
•	Maintain a welcoming and tidy office environment for clients, visitors, and team. 
•	Answer and direct incoming calls 
•	Maintain office resources (space, furniture, supplies, office technology equipment)
•	Keep office space and kitchen clean and restocked.
•	Assist the whole team with all office functions.
•	Responsible for regularly reviewing the calendar for multiple advisors' scheduled meetings, re-evaluating priorities, and modifying appointments as needed.
•	Closely monitor email and other communications to ensure all scheduling is coordinated, logistics confirmed, and appropriate parties are promptly kept up to date and informed.
•	Utilizing good judgment in managing calendar appointments and anticipating the needs of the advisory team, and will partner to prioritize and triage incoming, ongoing, ever-changing meeting requests.
•	Generate reports for advisor's meetings with clients and after-meeting letters. 
•	Update contact management systems, such as SalesForce and Commonwealth CRM 
•	File and upload client statements, correspondence, agreements, etc.  
•	Assist with client mailings, events, and workshops.
•	Make suggestions to systematize and improve office functions. 
•	Sort and distribute mail, manage vendor relations, order office supplies, and manage sales material inventory.
•	General office tasks such as copying, scanning, sorting, and organization.
•	Serve as the safety coordinator (update evacuation plans, organize safety training, order equipment) and crisis event administrative representative.
•	Be able to lift at least 20 lbs.
 
* Candidates are tested for competency in software and office skills.
 
Our office is in San Ramon and provides a comfortable, professional work environment. Monday through Friday, 8:30 am to 5:00 pm. Salary starts at $65k -70k - depending on experience and qualifications; medical, dental, vision, and retirement plans available after 90-day probationary period. Must submit to fingerprinting and pass a background check. 
Room for advancement.

title: Teaching Artist @ Arts nonprofit
description:
POSITION DESCRIPTION 
Job title: 		                Teaching Artist, Float
Classification: 		Part-time regular position 
Pay range: 		        $25/hour starting wage
Hours per week:	        32 hrs/wk (~4.5 days) 
Reports to: 		        Director, Programs
Application Review: 	February 1, 2024

ABOUT CREATIVITY EXPLORED 
Creativity Explored (CE) is a studio-based collective in San Francisco that partners with developmentally disabled people to celebrate and nurture the creative potential in all of us. Founded in 1983, CE has facilitated the careers of hundreds of disabled artists and serves as a model in the field of art and disability worldwide. 

CE now serves over 130 developmentally disabled artists offering art supplies, training, exhibition, sales and licensing opportunities in traditional and digital media. CE artists have seen their work exhibited in museums, galleries, and art fairs in over 14 countries and have earned over $2 million from their art. CE's life-changing programs continue to open doors of inclusion to center the personhood and creative vision of people with developmental disabilities. Most importantly, CE is a source of community, empowerment and dignity. 

Creativity Explored is an equal opportunity employer committed to building and sustaining an equitable and inclusive work environment where diversity is celebrated and valued. BIPOC, people with disabilities, and bilingual/bicultural individuals are strongly encouraged to apply. 

POSITION OVERVIEW 
The Teaching Artist supports developmentally disabled studio artists as they develop a meaningful arts practice. The Teaching Artist will be a practicing artist who has experience as an arts educator, with the ability to facilitate growth for artists with diverse needs and practices. The ideal candidate will foster reflection and curiosity for CE artists, and will be skilled in developing relationships with artists, fellow teaching artists, and staff in other CE departments. 
The Teaching Artist will collaborate with other staff and volunteers to develop and implement a scaffolded art curriculum that meets the needs of artists, while participating as a member of the direct service team. We are looking for expertise in mediums such as painting, drawing, sculpture, and/or ceramics.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 
Led by the Creativity Explored Program Team, Teaching Artists will support CE’s artists by:
*Proceeding from respect for the individual preferences and choices of each studio artist 
*Encouraging each studio artist to find their own voice and develop a unique style of artwork.
*Developing strong relationships with artists and helping them in facilitating their art practice.
*Encouraging the development of a deep and focused art practice that meets the artists’ potential 
*Working collaboratively on projects across the organization that advance the goals of Creativity Explored 

Artist Support 
*Assessing artistic skills, establishing goals for each assigned artist and developing teaching strategies to assist each artist in meeting their goals 
*Participating actively in teams that develop and implement person centered plans for each artist 
*Participating actively in a learning community centered around person-centered thinking
*Engaging in additional training that helps teaching artists identify and develop skills that support the organization’s goals 

Studio Operations 
*Attending to all individual studio artists’ needs 
*Being able to use specialized equipment like a kiln (ceramics) or woodworking tools.
*Ensuring that studio artists are safely supervised at all times. 
*Ensuring all activities are conducted in a safe and prudent manner by following studio policies.
*Maintaining clean, organized and orderly work areas and storage for art works in progress
*Ensuring that all reporting requirements are completed according to established guidelines 

Inclusion 
*Planning activities and working with artists in community settings (i.e. Art Explosion studio).
*Accompanying studio artists on art-related outings in the community 
*Assisting artists with artist talks & presentations of their art work 
*Facilitating participation in special projects and public-facing activities such as public art projects, community events, and arts partnerships 

Exhibitions, Marketing and Partnerships 
*Assisting other staff to select, prepare, exhibit and market studio artists’ work
*Ensuring that all studio artists who wish to present their art work have an opportunity to do so 
*Assisting Exhibition and Gallery Coordinators to promote individual studio artists by identifying outside exhibition and sales venues and/ or opportunities, and ensuring that work meets the venue’s presentation standards 

Other Duties
*Supporting other departments of Creativity Explored to raise funds for and promote the organization. 
*Regularly participating in collaborative activities that support CE’s plans across departments Examples: professional development, serving on committees, and working with groups to plan organization wide initiatives. 
*Contributing to the development and improvement of CE programs 
*Performing other reasonably related duties as requested. 

ORGANIZATIONAL RELATIONSHIP
The Teaching Artist is expected to work productively in a team environment and provide leadership as a member of our Studio Program Team and engage with other staff across the organization. They are also expected to work towards embodying the four components of CE's Staff Philosophy: Community, Creativity, Collaboration, and Compassion.

COMPLIANCE WITH POLICIES AND PROCEDURES
The Teaching Artist will comply with established Creativity Explored policies and practices. 

KEY SELECTION CRITERIA 
*Post-secondary education in fine arts or other arts related or equivalent experience.
*Creative capacity reflected in personal art making record, portfolio, exhibition history
*Process-based, inquiry-based approach to artmaking 
*Growth mindset, with strong ability to collaborate with people across the organization
*Interest in or experience working with people with disabilities in an arts context
*Excellent communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively with people with developmental disabilities 
*Ability to work in a team-based environment, as well as work independently
*Sound organizational skills 
*Bilingual/bicultural a plus 

TRAINING & COMPLIANCE REQUIREMENTS 
*Complete and maintain CPR, First Aid, and AED certification (initial certification to be completed within 30 days of date of hire)
*Workplace Harassment Training
*Complete Creativity Explored staff training pertinent to position job responsibilities as assigned

OTHER INFORMATION 
This position is an ongoing regular, part-time position with daytime Tuesdays-Saturdays hours. This position will have 3 set work days working in the studio with additional work days assigned weekly as needed by CE. Specific schedule and number of hours will be determined during the hiring process. The position is eligible to receive benefits as described in Creativity Explored Personnel Policies, including vacation, holiday and sick leave, health, dental and vision insurance, and commuter benefits. 

Offers are subject to satisfactory Criminal Records Clearance, proof of Covid Vaccination, and negative TB test results completed within the last 12 months.

To apply, please go to our website for job application instructions https://www.creativityexplored.org/news/category/Jobs

Application includes:
Cover letter stating why you are interested in the position,  any previous relevant experience, and why you would be a good fit for this position
Resumé

PDF format only. No calls, please.

title: Manufacturing Preventive Maintenance Supervisor$90k-$110k
description:
Ideal candidate: Pays close attention to details.

Responsibilities:

Supervise and manage a team of maintenance technicians, provide guidance, support, and performance feedback.
Manage execution of the preventative maintenance schedule to ensure timely and proactive maintenance of equipment and facilities.
Conduct daily start-up meetings with maintenance technicians to assign tasks, review work priorities, and ensure effective communication.
Assess and assign new work orders to technicians based on their skill, experience, and knowledge, considering workload distribution and technician capabilities.
Manage maintenance data documentation in the organization’s comprehensive maintenance management system, provide guidance and support for technicians’ retrieval and input of such data.
Interface with vendors as needed to obtain quotes for materials, parts, service, repair, etc., and monitor the execution of activities by outside vendors.
Generate and route purchase order requisitions for approval, ensure timely procurement of necessary supplies and resources.
Effectively manage spare parts inventory, ensure critical minimum quantities are maintained and provide feedback for necessary threshold updates.
Oversee the management of shop stock inventory, ensure necessary 30-day quantities are maintained and provide feedback for necessary threshold updates.
Manage the inventory of tools and equipment, ensure availability and serviceability of tools, machinery, and special equipment used by maintenance technicians.
Monitor and conduct maintenance qualification training for each maintenance technician, identify areas for improvement and provide necessary support.
Track the status of all maintenance technicians' program compliance training, including safety protocols, confined space procedures, hot work regulations, electrical work guidelines, working at heights, PPE management and use, respiratory protection, HAZCOM, HAZMAT/HAZWASTE awareness and handling, emergency response, permit to work, and lockout/tagout procedures.


Requirements:

3+ years’ experience in a supervisory/coordination role in machine maintenance or related field.
8+ years’ experience in relevant maintenance areas preferred: CNC machines, industrial furnaces, grinding machines, ball mills, lathes, HVAC, plumbing, electrical, general construction.
Proficient computer skills, including experience with inventory management systems and Microsoft Office Suite. Experience with maintenance management software required.
In-depth knowledge of maintenance practices, procedures, and safety regulations.
Strong leadership and communication skills to effectively manage and motivate a team.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Ability to prioritize tasks, manage multiple assignments, and meet deadlines.
Familiarity with purchasing processes and requisition generation.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to make informed decisions.

title: Executive Assistant For Local Boutique Commercial Real Estate CEO
description:
Job Label: HBI2024-EA
Join a visionary boutique real estate developer on a mission to support Bay Area entrepreneurs by delivering awesome workspaces, community, and rock-solid service.

Our small team is nimble, creative, diverse, independent, and cohesive. We love our work, and we love working together. 

Would you thrive in a people-centric role that offers decision-making responsibility and the freedom to work independently as part of a tight-knit crew making a positive impact every day? 

If the answer is yes, and you: 

…Love working with entrepreneurs and managing a wide variety of projects,

…Are a strong negotiator, a get-it-done kind of person who insists on getting it done right, enjoys juggling multiple tasks while keeping everything in order, and doesn’t ever lose track of loose ends, 

…And are cool under pressure, always ready to pick up the phone, and not afraid to push back when appropriate. 

…then we’d love to consider you for a role with us. 

As Executive Assistant to the CEO, you will be the main point of contact for our tenants and for the CEO on a day-to-day basis, owning the process of providing an inspiring workspace for our tenants. You will be the primary liaison between tenants, contractors, our CEO, and other company staff, managing projects to keep our tenants and ownership happy, the buildings clean and safe, and the onsite environments thriving and vibrant. You make it all happen—and you make sure it’s great! 

We are a ​speciality commercial real estate development company on a mission to support Bay Area entrepreneurs by delivering awesome workspaces, community, and rock-solid service. Our premiere property is The York, an office-space community filled with a broad cast of entrepreneurs, start-ups, and professionals.​​

The success of our properties depends upon a happy, trustworthy, professional, and technology-savvy individual with a wide range of skills and grace under pressure. We need someone with well-honed, highly professional communication and organizational skills and the energy required to willingly handle a variety of responsibilities and make sound operational decisions, someone who appreciates systems and structure but don't get overly bogged down in process and someone who is ready to act independently with a high degree of integrity and responsibility, acting on behalf of the business as if it was their own. 

We're looking for someone who brings the following specific skills and experience to the table: 


	
	Outstanding customer service 
	
	
	Highly professional written and verbal communication
	
	
	Strong start-to-finish project management 
	
	
	Solution-based thinking
	
	
	Vendor negotiation and management
	
	
	Read, modify and create contracts 
	
	
	Efficient time management
	
	
	Computer and tech savvy
	
	
	Impeccable documentation and record-keeping 
	
	
	Ability to learn quickly 
	
	
	Epic discernment and decision-making
	
	
	Comfortable working independently as well as part of a team
	
	
	At least 2 years of high-level CEO executive assistant experience 
	
	
	Some exposure to real estate business, project management, general contracting and/or property management
	
	
	Familiarity with software tools such as Asana, Pipedrive, MS Office, Quickbooks
	


As Executive Assistant, your primary responsibilities will include: 


	
	Owner of overall tenant happiness
	
	
	First point of contact for tenants, responding to inbound tenant requests for service 
	
	
	Manage services and subcontractors required to fulfill tenant tenant service requests and keep our properties humming, including networking, electrical, plumbing, HVAC, locksmith, etc. 
	
	
	Liaise with on-site building maintenance staff, and order and purchase materials and supplies
	
	
	Liaise with on-site IT to manage internet connectivity and internal network configuration 
	
	
	Manage tenant on- and off-boarding 
	
	
	Support the CEO as executive assistant for travel, calendaring, and personal tasks
	
	
	Process, document and file CEO’s work notes
	
	
	Manage the CEO’s calendar 
	
	
	Work from home (in Marin), with the CEO (in Larkspur), and on-site at our properties in San Francisco and Marin as required
	
	
	Lead the process of advertising to find new tenants as openings occur
	
	
	Manage to “perfect data” using and updating our project management, CRM, internal documentation and other systems on an ongoing basis
	
	
	Create & manage occasional on-site community events 
	


If you’re driven by overcoming challenges and realizing successes, love working with people, have a positive, can-do attitude, and are resourceful and budget-conscious as well as a bit of a shapeshifter, we’d love to have you join the team.


	
        To apply for this position or refer someone you know, please use our online interview system managed by HireMojo.
    
    Apply for this job
    https://app.hiremojo.com/mojo/ce/502467687/The-York/California/San-Francisco/Executive-Assistant?sourceType=9 
    
        Once you have completed the interview, your information will be forwarded to the recruiting team for decisions on next steps.
    

Related Keywords: property manager, project manager, executive assistant, CEO assistant, customer service, real estate

description:

title: Seafood Manager
description:
About Us:

Mollie Stone’s Markets is a local, family-owned grocery store chain in the San Francisco Bay area, serving customers since 1986. With over 30 years of exemplary performance in the market, Mollie Stone’s continues to make a difference in people’s lives through food. Currently maintaining 9 Grocery Stores, a Produce Warehouse and Headquarters in Mill Valley, CA, we succeed in the industry by ensuring we deliver a large variety of exciting and quality products in an attractive and positive environment.

Please apply online: https://molliestones.applytojob.com/apply/Gtb7TBTIdL/Seafood-ManagerFT-SF-Bay-Area-Applicants-Only

About the Role:

Mollie Stone’s Markets is looking for a Full Time Seafood Manager to work at our Greenbrae location in Marin County.  The perfect candidate will have at least 3-5 years seafood experience, 2-3 years of hands-on management experience, great people skills and the ability to inspire a team.



Essential Functions:

Establish and maintain a positive work environment.
Follow department procedures to maintain supplies.
Know product availability, preparation, storage and nutritional aspects.
Manage inventory and pricing, including signage, to achieve required margin and labor targets.
Supervise and maintain special order system.
Follow and comply with established procedures, including Weights and Measures, health and sanitation, and adhere to safe work practices.
Operate and sanitize all equipment in a safe and proper manner.
Safely use grinder, tenderizer, saw, and knives to cut, trim, and prepare meat products.
Ability to give excellent and consistent customer service.


Minimum Qualifications:

3-5 years previous experience in a grocery Seafood department.
Knowledge of and ability to Filet different seafood.
Prior department operations and staff management experience.
Good communicator and motivator; able to work well with others and convey enthusiasm.
Must be self-motivated and solution-oriented.
Can train and inspire a diverse group of Team Members to excellence in all aspects of the department.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Available for flexible scheduling to meet the needs of the department including morning, evenings, and weekends.
Local candidates only.


Physical Requirements:

Must be able to regularly lift at least 60 lbs.
Standing: Up to 8 hours per day.
Seating: Up to 1 hours per day.
Walking: Up to 8 hours per day.
Reaching: Up to 6 hours per day.


About the Benefits:

This is a union position with competitive pay.
Comprehensive Medical Insurance
Dental and Vision Insurance
Life Insurance
Employee Assistance Program
Pension Program
Commuter Benefits
Entertainment Discounts
20% Employee Discount on Mollie Stone’s Purchases
Paid Time Off
Pay range:

29.17 + hourly depending on industry experience.

Why should you apply?

You want to enjoy what you do.
You know what it takes to provide outstanding customer service.
You would like to join a local, family owned company who values you.
You get to enjoy and rely on great benefits and perks for you and your family.
You’ll have opportunity to learn, grow and advance in your career.
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time.



Mollie Stone’s Markets is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: HR Manager/Payroll for Amazing Transportation Company - $85K Starting
description:
Are you looking for an exceptional career opportunity?
 
Atech Logistics & Distribution is growing and looking for the right person to join our corporate team in Santa Rosa, CA. 

Atech Logistics & Distribution is a family-owned and operated transportation company with roots in Sonoma County and locations throughout the 11 Western United States.  At Atech, we believe our people are our greatest assets.  We treat our employees like family and provide them with the necessary tools and resources to excel in their careers.  We measure success by our employee’s success.  If you are interested in working with great people at a great company, join our team!
 
BASIC FUNCTION:

The Human Resources Manager will be responsible for administering and processing bi-weekly, multi-state payroll for 200+ employees, as well as overseeing a wide range of department-related tasks in support of the Human Resources Director.

The ideal candidate is an experienced professional in both HR and Payroll related tasks, with expertise in a wide range of payroll functions and multi-state wage and hour laws.  We’re looking for an organized, detail-oriented self-starter who is comfortable working both independently and as part of a team to meet deadlines and deliver a superior work product.
  
Key Areas of Responsibility:
 
•	Managing, implementing and developing all aspects of the company’s payroll functions while ensuring accurate and timely payments for all employees in compliance with federal and state regulations.    
•	Staying abreast of changing regulations to ensure compliance with multi-state and federal wage and hour laws as they pertain to payroll, HR and the trucking industry.  Provide applicable information to HR Director and the Executive Team.
•	Processing a large volume of Wage Garnishments and Medical Support Notices from various state agencies while maintaining compliance with state-specific laws.
•	Facilitating management and employee understanding of payroll procedures and providing ongoing training as necessary.
•	Staying current on payroll systems to achieve alignment with Human Resources department.
•	Offering suggestions/making improvements to payroll/HR department systems, processes and procedures to ensure efficiency and effectiveness.
•	Working in close conjunction with Human Resources Director to ensure department goals and objectives are being achieved.  
•	Overseeing various daily aspects of the HR department including, but not limited to recruiting, onboarding and offboarding, compliance, benefits administration, monthly benefits bill reconciliation, employee relations, etc.
•	Assisting with end of year reporting (e.g. ACA, OSHA, EEO, etc.)
•	Performing other related duties as necessary or assigned

Required Skills & Abilities:

•	Excellent verbal and written communication skills
•	Acute attention to detail
•	Excellent organizational and time management skills
•	Self-starter, able to plan, organize, implement and follow through on projects 
•	Able to multi-task and prioritize duties while meeting deadlines
•	Excellent interpersonal skills, being able to employ a high degree of tact, patience, and professionalism when interfacing with varying personalities
•	Proficient with the use of computers including Human Resource management software, spreadsheets, word processing, and payroll software
•	Maintain business confidentiality and professionalism
•	Team player
•	Positive attitude
•	Willingness to learn

Education & Experience:

•	Degree or certificate in human resources or related field with appropriate coursework, OR equivalent education and experience that would prepare one for the responsibilities of the job required
•	3-5 years of HR experience, with strong expertise in multi-state payroll administration required 
•	Expertise in multi-state wage and hour laws required
•	HR Certification (PHR/SPHR or SHRM-CP/SHRM-SCP) highly preferred
•	Previous experience in selecting and implementing payroll/HRIS technologies a plus       
•	Bilingual in English and Spanish a plus
•	Related transportation and logistics experience helpful but not necessary

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

•	While performing duties of this job, would occasionally be required to sit, stand, walk, reach with hands and arms, stoop or kneel, talk and hear, and use fingers and hands to feel objects, tools, or controls.
•	Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer
•	Must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds
•	Specific vision abilities required include close vision, distance vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

We offer a great benefits package including:  Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k), Employee Assistance Program, and company-paid Life Insurance!

If you are an experienced professional in HR and payroll, have a great attitude and acute attention to detail, and want to work for an amazing company with great benefits, please submit your resume and cover letter to hr@atechlogistics.com.  

For more information about our company and the benefits that we offer, please visit our website at www.atechlogistics.com. 

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee.  Management reserves the right to add or make changes to this job description at any time.

title: General Contractor Looking to Hire: Foreman
description:
General Contractor in Rohnert Park has steady work.  We are looking to hire skilled and an experienced Foreman. Our business continues to grow, and we need the right leadership people to join our team! We have a wide variety of residential projects that include interior/exterior work. We primarily focus on remodels, but occasionally some new construction. We need "reliable and skilled" professionals who take responsibility for their work on the job site. 

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
• Positions require 15+ years of construction experience with residential remodels and new builds.
• Foreman must have ability to supervise and multiple teams to perform all phases of rough/finish carpentry, travel between multiple sites and supervise 8-10 employees onsite and/or subcontractors.
• Must have the ability to read architectural/structural engineering plans.
• Foreman must be able to direct and mentor laborer apprentices/journeyman carpenters as needed to keep the job moving forward and ensure every team is working productively with an assembly line approach to productivity – not having team members working as individuals.
• Positions must be well-organized on job site, proactively follow Project Manager’s schedule for task assignments to meet target dates for self/team.
• Foreman will pickup job materials at various local vendors.
• Position must be able to work with Project Manager and communicate potential risk/issues associated with job so that Project Manager can mitigate action plan.
• Position must have the ability to problem-solve as remodels are not new construction and you will be faced with challenging situations to implement design requirements. It will not be a perfect environment like new construction.
• Must have a team player and positive can-do attitude, otherwise do not apply.

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:
• Must be able to work in Sonoma, Napa and Marin counties. Fuel allowance will be provided.
• Must have a reliable and verifiable work history in the building trades.
• Must be detail oriented and able to complete team assignments on time.
• Ability to communicate well with others (as needed).
• Must have excellent customer service with clients.
• Must be able to legally work in the US and provide proof.
• Must have valid driver’s license.
• Must be able to speak English, bilingual is a plus.
• Drinking/drugs will not be tolerated on job site.

COMPENSATION:
• Competitive compensation determined by experience.
• 5-paid sick days annually.
• 401K retirement plan (match based on company performance).
• Fuel allowance provided until Company gas card provided for business usage.
• 7 holidays observed annually.

*** PLEASE SUBMIT RESUME WITH CONTACT INFORMATION AND JOB HISTORY ****

title: Maintenance Technician
description:

title: Saint Francis Yacht Club - Executive Sous Chef
description:
The mission of St. Francis Yacht Club is to serve as the inspirational center
of boating activities regionally, and a leader of yachting internationally. 
We honor camaraderie, sportsmanship, tradition and the maritime heritage
of San Francisco in a premier yachting environment. 

Founded in 1927, St. Francis Yacht Club is steeped in over 90 years of yachting traditions. From the beginning, St. Francis Yacht Club’s membership has included many of the Bay Area’s most prominent citizens and greatest sailors. The Club’s annual regatta schedule is one of the most active in the world. Both physically beautiful and naturally demanding, the Bay provides a racer with the ultimate in wind, current and weather conditions for truly competitive, exciting sailing.

Adjacent to the Marina District, the clubhouse provides a boating and social venue for members and their guests, featuring deep-water guest docks, outstanding dining amenities and incredible vistas of the Golden Gate Bridge and San Francisco Bay. The Club boasts a professional staff, excellent dining rooms, inviting bars and spectacular private party facilities, not to mention extensive experience in accommodating regattas of all kinds and sizes. 

In addition to the city-based clubhouse, Tinsley Island is our private slice of paradise, located 60 miles up the Delta from St. Francis Yacht Club. This 40-acre oasis is accessed by a Club-owned launch or private boat and offers a year-round getaway for our members, featuring dockage and houseboats, on-island lodging and kitchen facilities, a swimming pool, small boat fleet for member use and a variety of other diversions in a rustic, relaxing setting. 


Position: Executive Sous Chef	
Department: Kitchen
Reports to: Executive Chef
Type: Full Time, Exempt, Benefits eligible 
Pay: $85,000 - $90,000 annually

Job Summary 

Assist the Executive Chef in supervising food production for all food outlets, banquet events, and other functions.   Supervise food production tasks and staff to ensure quality and cost standards are consistently attained.

Essential Functions

•	Understand and practice The Club core values and mission.
•	Assist Executive Chef in menu planning.
•	Work with 2 separate dining venues; casual and fine dining.
•	Performs all necessary supervisory functions for subordinates; develops performance standards; trains; and directs ongoing work.
•	Train kitchen staff on recipes, prep and menu items to ensure recipes are accurately prepared.
•	Maintains standards of quality, cost, eye appeal and flavor of foods.
•	Participate in rotation and proper storage of products and deliveries.
•	Supervise sanitation, cleanliness, and maintenance of kitchen and equipment, ensuring that all Health Department codes are met.
•	Work with the team on any preparations or tasks needed to ensure customer satisfaction.


Job Tasks 

•	Maintains the highest standards of sanitation and hygiene in all food service areas.
•	Accurately executes orders when needed and creates and manages production lists for a la carte dining, banquets, regattas and special events.
•	Assists in preparing and interpreting banquet event orders.
•	Plans or assists in planning special events and menus.
•	Produces daily production lists and delegates tasks to ensure food is prepared in a timely fashion.
•	Assures that food quality standards and pre-determined labor and food costs are attained in all outlets.
•	Develops and standardizes recipes for all menu items.
•	Documents and distributes culinary specifications for all menu items with preparation method, ingredients and accurate descriptions for kitchen and service staff.
•	Maintains organization, cleanliness and proper function of all cooking equipment and food service facilities on property.
•	Maintains proper standards for uniforms, tools, equipment, and facilities in use by culinary staff.
•	Interacts effectively with all staff to accomplish assigned tasks.


Qualifications 

•	Degree from an ACF approved, post-secondary culinary arts training program or equivalent education and/or experience.
•	Four+ years of experience in a professional food preparation management position, encompassing all phases of food service and kitchen operations. 
•	ServSafe Manager Certification.

Preferred Qualifications:
•	Previous private club, restaurant or hotel work experience.
•	Experience managing multi-venue food service establishment.
•	ACF Certification at CSC or CEC level.
•	Management experience in a Union environment.

Physical Demands and Work Environment
•	Able to work 10 or more hours a day during busy seasons.
•	Required to stand for long periods and walk, climb stairs, balance, stoop, kneel, crouch, bend, stretch, and twist or reach.
•	Push, pull, and/or lift to 50 pounds.
•	Continuous repetitive motions
•	Work in hot, humid, and/or noisy environment

Confidentiality
Must uphold the highest level of confidentiality regarding information, files, and subjects discussed. 

TO APPLY
Please send a copy of your resume with a cover letter to jobs@stfyc.com. Applications are also accepted at  
https://recruiting.myapps.paychex.com/appone/MainInfoReq.asp?R_ID=5992456. All applications and inquiries will receive a response and will be kept strictly confidential. 

As a preeminent member of the international sailing community, St. Francis Yacht Club welcomes members, and their guests from around the world, and we are committed to ensuring that all feel comfortable at our club. We believe by fostering diversity, equity, and inclusion we are engendering the camaraderie, sportsmanship, and respect for tradition which represent our core values. Everyone within our facilities is expected to treat all others with courtesy and respect. We endeavor to grow the sport of boating by creating a welcoming environment for all who share our love of the water and the St. Francis Yacht Club, irrespective of race, ethnicity, religious creed, disability, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, age, or national origin.

title: Staff Accountant
description:
We are seeking candidates for an opening at our small CPA firm. A staff accountant will handle the following tasks for assigned small business clients.
- Extensive data entry into QuickBooks, either desktop or online
- Performing bank reconciliation each month
- Preparing and filing quarterly sales tax
- Running payroll 
- Any other tasks as assigned from time to time by the CPA

Qualifications
- AS or BS degree in accounting
- Experience with QuickBooks required
- Quick learner with the commitment to follow the established procedure
- Trustworthy

Language
- English & Vietnamese prefered but not required

Compensation
- DOE
- Paid PTO: sick leave, 2-week vacation and 10 public holidays
- 401K, cost-sharing health insurance and group life insurance

title: Maintenance Technician | Pressure Washer | Full-time | Part-time
description:
Maintenance Technician Levels 1-3 -
A Maintenance Technician is responsible for conducting general maintenance and repairs on commercial properties. The goal is to maintain the facilities and common areas in the best possible conditions. Schedule: Tuesday-Saturday Typical start times: 6AM-3PM depending on the day. FULL TIME.

Perform troubleshooting, diagnostics, and repairs on commercial buildings.
Complete work orders for a variety of structure and equipment repairs.
Estimate time and materials effectively.
Order necessary materials for repair completion.
Complete all necessary paperwork upon finalization of the work orders.
Perform daily inspection of building systems.
Have knowledge of tools and equipment used in ground and facility maintenance environments.
Have experience with various following tasks; Painting, concrete work, finish, and repair, electrical including changing commercial lighting ballast, plumbing, drywall patch and repair, and overall basic handyman work.

A minimum of 3 years’ experience in a similar role
Basic analytical and computer skills.
Exceptional communication and problem-solving abilities.
The ability to work extra hours or change schedule as required by customer needs
Capable to drive truck with trailer, including planning routes and following all traffic laws
Understand oral and written instructions.
Use hand tools and power equipment safely and correctly
Lift up to 50 pounds to complete assigned work 
Clean and neat appearance 

Pressure Washing Technician - 
Driving the company Pressure Washing truck to pressure wash the following:  
Parking garages  
Walkways 
Graffiti removal  
Façade cleaning 
Garbage enclosures  
Other areas as assigned. 
Adherence to all safety rules and procedures.  
Communicate effectively with management.  
Completion photos are required to be uploaded through the company portal. 
Responsible for inputting accurate mileage while fueling company vehicles.  
Able to use software emails, teams chat, and portal on the company phone.  
Maintain equipment in a neat, clean, safe, and good working condition.  
Perform other duties as assigned by management. 

At least one (1) year of experience operating a full-size truck with good sense of direction (routing) Conditioned to perform physically demanding and repetitive work. 
Exceptional communication and problem-solving abilities. 
Must be able to pass a background check, and physical exam. 
Reliable transportation to job site 

Qualifications and Skills

2 or more years of Graveyard Experience
2 or more years of Commercial High Pressure Power Washing
Must have experience with a "Commercial Pressure Washer, hot water, truck mounted with a minimum 3000 PSI
Communicate effectively with management
Valid driver's license with 3 years of clean DMV history (Copy of MVR)
Experience with driving a truck with trailer
Strong map reading and routing skills
Conditioned to perform physically demanding and repetitive work

Able to work extra hours, weekends, and/or changed schedules as needed to fulfill customer request. 
Able to work nights / Graveyard work shifts.  
Clean and neat appearance
Schedule: Sunday-Thursday 7:30AM-3:30PM PART TIME 37.5 hours a week. 



*PLEASE ATTACH YOUR RESUME WHEN INQUIRING ABOUT POSITION*

title: Inspector Surveyor Position
description:
Seeking Independent Contractors to perform Insurance based Residential and/or Commercial Property surveys in California. We have immediate work available in all the Counties of California. Applicants must have reliable transportation and be able to accurately photograph, measure, and complete survey forms of residential properties.
Qualifications
-Must be able to submit reports in on-time by mandatory due dates.
-Must be able to provide an accurate and quality report defined by client specifications.
-Experience in this field is preferred, but highly driven and independent person will succeed as well.
-Professionalism, Accountability, & Communication Skills
-Basic-Intermediate Computer Skills
-High Speed Internet
-Camera with minimum 10X zoom
-Chrome & Internet Explorer Web Browsers
-Measuring device to measure square footage of building
-Must pass background check
Position Details
-Part-time contract work available based on territory and volume
-Pay is based on a flat fee per inspection completed
-Perfect position for existing Field Surveyor looking to add to their book of business
-Perfect for those looking for additional income opportunities

title: Personal Aide - In Home Part Time
description:
Seeking a mature reliable individual with experience working with young adults with developmental disabilities. ABA experience is preferred but training can be provided.

Duties include daily living support, supervision, meal prep, light house-hold tasks and companionship to 23 yr. old with severe autism.

Hours are 9am to 2pm every Tuesday and Wednesday.
 
Client has an ABA therapy program at home from 10am to 2pm with an agency and requires an adult to be present.

Client is a great young man, a trooper and fun to work with though there are occasional challenges that can be overcome.

Please respond with your resume.

title: Maintenance/Janitor - Harrison Hotel
description:
Please apply here: https://careers-jsco.icims.com/jobs/5291/maintenance---janitor/job

OVERVIEW:

COMPANY SUMMARY:

The John Stewart Company is a full-service housing management, development and consulting organization that began in 1978 with a commitment to providing high quality service in the affordable housing sector. We work to enrich the lives of our residents and employees, while delivering our services cost‐effectively, efficiently and with the highest levels of professionalism, compassion, integrity and respect.

SUMMARY OF THE POSITION:

Performs a wide variety of maintenance and janitorial duties. This position performs a wide variety of maintenance duties including preventative, emergency, cosmetic and routine maintenance and regular inspections. Nature of work requires emphasis on safe work practices, sustained physical effort, trouble shooting, problem solving, attention to detail, customer service and time management.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

- Works with Property Manager to conduct routine monthly safety hazard and maintenance deficiency inspections in accordance with JSCo and Uniform Physical Condition Standards (UPCS).
- Perform electrical, plumbing, mechanical, carpentry, masonry, plastering, painting tasks and janitorial duties as assigned.
- Operates and makes all installations and repairs in accordance with local, state and national codes.
- Performs timely apartment unit turn-overs as directed by Property Manager.
- Performs routine work orders as necessary. Prepares work orders for safety hazards and deficiencies to specify on the work order.
- Participate in off-shift and weekend emergency maintenance coverage as scheduled.
- Report physical condition needs of common areas such as the grounds, building exteriors and takes corrective action.
- Performs overall upkeep of the grounds. Including but not limited to remove trash from the grounds, gather and empty trash and recycling bins, cleaning sidewalks, parking lots and carports.  Maintaining all areas are clean (i.e. by sweeping, mopping, scrubbing, or vacuuming). 
- Performs monthly safety hazard and maintenance deficiency inspection.
- Creates and implements preventive maintenance schedule.

QUALIFICATIONS:

- Must possess valid California driver’s license & must possess reliable, insured and registered vehicle
- Basic mathematical skills with fluency in reading, writing and communication in English.
- A minimum of 3 years of multi-family apartment maintenance experience.
- Knowledge of precautions and safety procedures for working with ACM/LBP in pre-1981 housing.
- Ability to perform maintenance and repair building trades such as carpentry, plumbing, electrical, HVAC system, appliance repair, painting, drywall, plaster, fire protection system etc.
- Ability to recognize safety hazards and take precautionary measures to protect self and others.
 
BENEFITS:

Benefits for Employees who work 30+ hours/week -

Medical, dental and vision care; preventative medical care paid at 100%.
Vacation leave of up to ten days per year in the first year.
Up to 72 hours of sick time per year.
Flexible Spending Accounts for Health Care and Dependent Care.
Company paid Life AD&D Long Term Disability.
Free, confidential counseling through our Employee Assistance Program.
Commuter benefit program.
Discounts for AT&T and ClassPass.
$50 annual Wellness Reimbursement.
Matching 401(K) Retirement Savings Plan of up to 2% of your compensation (for any employee who works 20 hours or more per week).
 
Benefits for Employees who work less than 30 hours/week - 

Free, confidential counseling through our Employee Assistance Program.
Commuter benefit program.
Discounts for AT&T and ClassPass.
$50 annual Wellness Reimbursement.
Matching 401(K) Retirement Savings Plan of up to 2% of your compensation (for any employee who works 20 hours or more per week)
Up to 72 hours of sick time per year.

Equal Opportunity Employer:
The John Stewart Company provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, or any other consideration made unlawful by federal, state, or local laws.

The John Stewart Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative.

California Consumer Privacy Act:
Effective January 1, 2020, the California Consumer Privacy Act requires businesses that meet certain minimum threshold requirements to provide a “notice at collection” to applicants for employment who reside in California.  The notice at collection describes the categories of personal information to be collected about these California applicants and the purposes for using that personal information.  Therefore, we have posted the Company’s “Notice At Collection For California Applicants” here.  Please review this Notice at your convenience.

title: Civil and / or Structural Engineer
description:
This job posting is for principal applicants only. 
(Recruiters and independent contractors, please do not contact.)

This is a full-time and in-person position. 

REQUIRED Minimum Qualifications
(No exceptions – do not contact unless you meet these qualifications):
•	Bachelor’s Degree in Civil or Structural Engineering from an ABET accredited program
•	California Engineer in Training Certificate (EIT)
•	Resident of the California Central Coast or the Bay Area
•	Great communication and teamwork skills
•	Strong analytical, graphics, and problem solving skills

Preferred Qualifications:
•	Professional Engineer (PE) license
•	2 years of professional experience
•	AutoCAD or Civil 3D experience
•	Public Works and Transportation experience

Responsibilities:
•	Collaborate with our team and clients to provide conceptual and final design solutions
•	Investigate and prepare design plans for buildings, parks, roads, schools, bridges, harbor facilities and water infrastructure
•	Prepare calculations, cost estimates, quantities and specifications
•	Provide construction administration and prepare site observation logs

Benefits:
Our competitive benefits package includes medical, dental and vision insurance, 401k retirement plan with employer match, annual profit sharing, paid time off, professional association membership, flexible schedule and annual bonus.

Firm Profile:
MME was established in 1987 to provide professional civil and structural engineering services for local governments and districts. Most of our projects are directed toward the civil and structural design of buildings, bridges, retaining walls, roads, parks, water tanks, pipelines, trails for pedestrians and cyclists, grading and drainage, parking facilities, street improvements, and water systems.

We are in search of talented and energetic people looking to creatively design and plan construction projects to benefit our community. This is an excellent opportunity to work in an award-winning, well-established firm with a collaborative studio environment. Our office is ideally situated downtown in the beautiful coastal community of Santa Cruz, California. We are just minutes from some of the best coastline in North America and many miles of world-class biking and hiking trails.

Please send a cover letter, resume, transcript (if applicable), and work samples to ginger@m-me.com to apply.

title: Bella Casa Home Staging- Assistant Designer Position
description:
Primary Skills
• Highly motivated and dynamic personality
• Highly organized and strong attention to detail
• Comfortable working with a team in a fast paced and changing environment 
• Visual merchandising and/or retail management experience a plus

Job Description
• Responsible for assisting the Lead Designer and Designers with home staging installations on an as needed basis. Tasks include cleaning, unpacking of bins, placement of accessories/decor, floral arrangements and styling.
• Responsible for overseeing and organizing staging removals.
• Responsible for the organization of the warehouse pertaining to unpacking and
restocking accessories and floral from removals. This position also includes various errands associated with the following: warehouse supplies, office supplies and home goods sourcing/purchasing.
